The E39 M5 is celebrated for its perfect balance of performance, handling, comfort, and practicality, representing a high point in the model's development before the introduction of more complex electronic systems.
BMW-M5.name: Third Generation (E39)

BMW-M5.description: The controversial E60 M5 featured a Formula 1-inspired 5.0L V10 engine producing 500 HP, paired with a seven-speed SMG automated manual transmission (a traditional six-speed manual was later offered in some markets). Available as a sedan (E60) and for the first time as a factory wagon (E61) in some markets, it represented a technological tour de force with electronic damper control, variable M differential, and multiple engine and transmission settings. While initially polarizing due to its complex electronics and Bangle-designed styling, this generation has gained appreciation for its unique, high-revving powertrain.
BMW-M5.name: Fourth Generation (E60/E61)

BMW-M5.description: The F10 M5 returned to V8 power, now with twin turbochargers, producing 560 HP (later 575 HP with the Competition Package). The seven-speed dual-clutch transmission provided quicker shifts than the previous SMG, though a manual was offered in some markets. Available only as a sedan, it featured a more luxurious interior, advanced technology including adjustable steering weight, and a more refined character than its predecessor. This generation marked the transition to forced induction for the M5, delivering massive torque increases and improved efficiency.
BMW-M5.name: Fifth Generation (F10)

BMW-M5.description: The F90 M5 featured an enhanced 4.4L twin-turbo V8 producing 600 HP (625 HP in Competition and CS variants), paired with an eight-speed automatic transmission. The biggest innovation was the addition of M xDrive all-wheel drive with a rear-wheel drive mode, providing both all-weather capability and traditional M car handling characteristics. Technology advanced with configurable drive modes, a digital instrument cluster, and enhanced driver assistance features. The limited-production CS variant offered reduced weight and enhanced performance.
BMW-M5.name: Sixth Generation (F90)

BMW-M5.description: The latest M5 continues the evolution with a plug-in hybrid powertrain combining a twin-turbo V8 with electric motors for increased performance and efficiency. Power is expected to exceed 700 HP, maintaining BMW M's performance focus while addressing emissions regulations. The exterior design features more aggressive styling, while the interior offers the latest technology including BMW's curved display. The seventh-generation M5 represents the model's adaptation to electrification while maintaining its position as BMW's high-performance executive sedan.
BMW-M5.name: Seventh Generation (G90)

BMW-X1.description: The original BMW X1 was the brand's first compact luxury crossover, based on the E91 3 Series Touring platform. Unlike later models, it featured a longitudinal engine layout with rear-wheel drive or xDrive all-wheel drive. Engine options included four-cylinder and six-cylinder petrol and diesel units. The E84 X1 offered car-like handling with a slightly elevated driving position and more versatile interior space. It established BMW in the growing compact premium crossover segment, though some markets initially viewed it as too similar to the 3 Series Touring.
BMW-X1.name: First Generation (E84)

BMW-X1.description: The F48 X1 marked a significant platform shift, moving to BMW's UKL front-wheel drive architecture shared with MINI. This change allowed for more efficient packaging, resulting in increased interior space despite similar exterior dimensions. Engine options were exclusively four-cylinder units with front-wheel drive standard and xDrive optional. The design became more SUV-like with a higher riding position and more upright stance. Technology advanced with larger infotainment screens, enhanced driver assistance systems, and improved connectivity. A plug-in hybrid variant (xDrive25e) was added later in the production run.
BMW-X1.name: Second Generation (F48)

BMW-X1.description: The current X1 builds on the UKL platform with more assertive styling featuring a larger kidney grille, angular headlights, and more pronounced body lines. It's slightly larger in all dimensions, offering increased passenger and cargo space. The interior represents a significant modernization with BMW's curved display combining digital instruments and infotainment, fewer physical buttons, and enhanced technology. Powertrain options include gasoline, diesel, and plug-in hybrid variants, with the all-electric iX1 joining the lineup for the first time. Performance has improved across the range, with the M35i offering up to 312 HP. The third-generation X1 has grown into a more substantial vehicle that better differentiates itself from BMW's sedan and hatchback offerings.
BMW-X1.name: Third Generation (U11)

BMW-X2.description: The original BMW X2 was positioned as a sportier, coupe-inspired alternative to the X1. Built on the same UKL platform, it featured a more aggressive design with a lower roofline, distinctive C-pillar roundels reminiscent of classic BMW coupes, and the first modern implementation of a forward-leaning kidney grille. The interior was largely shared with the X1 but with sportier accents. Engine options included a range of four-cylinder petrol and diesel units, with front-wheel drive on lower models and xDrive all-wheel drive on higher variants. The performance-oriented M35i model offered 302 HP, making it one of the most powerful four-cylinder BMW models at the time. While sacrificing some practicality compared to the X1, the X2 appealed to buyers seeking more distinctive styling in a compact crossover package. Production ran from November 2017 to October 2022.
BMW-X2.name: First Generation (F39)

BMW-X2.description: The current X2 represents a significant redesign, adopting a larger, more traditional coupe-SUV silhouette similar to the X4 and X6, rather than the hatchback-like profile of its predecessor. Based on the latest UKL platform shared with the third-generation X1, it features a more pronounced sloping roofline but has grown in all dimensions. The interior adopts BMW's latest technology including the curved display combining digital instruments and infotainment. Powertrain options include mild-hybrid petrol and diesel engines, and for the first time, an all-electric iX2. The performance-focused M35i xDrive offers 312 HP with enhanced suspension and braking. This generation positions the X2 more clearly as a style-focused alternative to the X1 while offering similar technology and features in a more distinctive package. Production began in November 2023.
BMW-X2.name: Second Generation (U10)

BMW-X3.description: The original BMW X3 pioneered the compact luxury SUV segment, based on a modified 3 Series platform. It featured permanent all-wheel drive (xDrive) and was positioned as a more agile, road-focused alternative to larger SUVs. Engine options included four and six-cylinder petrol and diesel units. While initially criticized for firm ride quality and some interior material choices, later models addressed these issues through updates. The first-generation X3 helped establish the premium compact SUV category that would later become one of the most competitive segments in the automotive market.
BMW-X3.name: First Generation (E83)

BMW-X3.description: The F25 X3 offered significant improvements in design, quality, and driving dynamics. Larger than its predecessor, it provided more interior space and improved ride comfort while maintaining the handling characteristics BMW was known for. Engine options expanded to include more efficient turbocharged four and six-cylinder units. Technology advanced with the introduction of BMW's iDrive system, available heads-up display, and advanced driver assistance features. This generation cemented the X3's position as one of BMW's core models and a segment benchmark.
BMW-X3.name: Second Generation (F25)

BMW-X3.description: The G01 X3 builds on its predecessors' success with more refined styling, enhanced technology, and improved performance. Built on BMW's CLAR platform, it offers a range of powertrains from efficient four-cylinders to the high-performance X3 M with up to 503 HP. The lineup expanded to include a plug-in hybrid variant (xDrive30e) and the all-electric iX3 in some markets. The interior features higher quality materials, larger displays, and advanced connectivity options. Throughout its evolution, the X3 has grown from a niche offering to one of BMW's global best-sellers, balancing practicality, technology, and driving dynamics in the highly competitive premium compact SUV segment.
BMW-X3.name: Third Generation (G01)

BMW-X3.description: In June 2021, BMW introduced a mid-life refresh for the G01 X3, with production beginning in July 2021 for the 2022 model year. The facelift updated the exterior styling with redesigned headlights receiving slight tinting and completely redone taillights. The front bumper was redesigned, and a 12.3-inch infotainment system became available for all trim levels. The interior technology was enhanced while maintaining the refined driving dynamics and comprehensive powertrain options that characterized the earlier G01 generation. This refresh kept the G01 competitive throughout the remainder of its production run before the next-generation G45 launch.
BMW-X3.name: Third Generation (G01 Facelift)

BMW-X3.description: The fourth-generation X3 G45 was unveiled on 19 June 2024, with sales commenced in late 2024 for the 2025 model year in North American and European markets. For the first time in X3 history, a long-wheelbase version (G48) was introduced exclusively for the Chinese market. Unlike the previous generation, BMW decided not to produce a high-performance X3 M variant, instead focusing the M brand on the battery-electric iX3. The G45 features BMW's curved display with iDrive 8.5, enhanced driver assistance systems, updated exterior design language, improved aerodynamics, and advanced connectivity features. Engine options include turbocharged four and six-cylinder petrol engines, plug-in hybrid variants, and the all-electric iX3, demonstrating BMW's commitment to electrification while maintaining performance and luxury standards.
BMW-X3.name: Fourth Generation (G45)

BMW-X4.description: The original BMW X4 pioneered the compact Sports Activity Coupe (SAC) segment for BMW, adapting the coupe-SUV concept of the larger X6 to a smaller platform. Based on the F25 X3, it featured a distinctive sloping roofline and more aggressive styling while sharing most mechanical components with its more practical sibling. Engine options included four and six-cylinder petrol and diesel units, all paired with all-wheel drive (xDrive) and an automatic transmission. The M40i performance variant offered a 355 HP turbocharged six-cylinder engine. While sacrificing some practicality compared to the X3, particularly in rear headroom and cargo space, the X4 appealed to buyers seeking more distinctive styling in a compact premium crossover.
BMW-X4.name: First Generation (F26)

BMW-X4.description: The second-generation X4 was revealed online in February 2018 as the successor to the F26 X4, with sales commenced in July 2018. It is based on the G01 X3 platform but features more differentiated styling than its predecessor, with a longer wheelbase, wider track, and lower height creating a more athletic profile. The interior offers similar technology and features to the X3 but with a more driver-focused layout. Engine options range from efficient four-cylinders to the high-performance X4 M with up to 503 HP from its twin-turbocharged six-cylinder engine. All models feature xDrive all-wheel drive and an automatic transmission as standard.
BMW-X4.name: Second Generation (G02)

BMW-X4.description: A comprehensive facelift in 2021 updated the exterior styling and interior technology, including a larger infotainment display and enhanced digital features. The mild hybrid 48-volt system was introduced for the xDrive20d in spring 2020. The facelifted X4 continues to cater to buyers seeking a more emotionally styled alternative to traditional SUVs, offering a compromise between utility and sporty design. BMW has indicated 2025 will be the X4's final model year.
BMW-X4.name: Second Generation (G02 Facelift)

BMW-X5.description: The original X5 was BMW's first SUV (dubbed 'Sports Activity Vehicle' by BMW), built on a unique platform with some components shared with the Range Rover L322, which BMW developed during their ownership of Land Rover. Unlike many competitors, the E53 focused on on-road performance rather than off-road capability, featuring a unibody construction instead of body-on-frame. Engine options ranged from six-cylinders to a 4.8L V8, with all models featuring all-wheel drive. The interior offered premium materials and a driver-focused layout. The first-generation X5 established BMW in the luxury SUV segment and influenced the subsequent development of road-focused premium SUVs.
BMW-X5.name: First Generation (E53)

BMW-X5.description: Production for the 2004 model year facelift began in late 2003. This facelift refresh updated the styling while maintaining the core platform and engineering of the original E53.
BMW-X5.name: First Generation (E53) 2004 Facelift

BMW-X5.description: The E70 X5 debuted in July 2006 for the 2007 model year. It grew in size and added an optional third row of seats for the first time. The design evolved BMW's SUV aesthetic with more pronounced styling elements while maintaining the sporty character of its predecessor. Engine options expanded to include more efficient options. Technology advanced significantly with the introduction of BMW's iDrive system, advanced driver assistance features, and active chassis systems including adaptive drive. In 2009, the X5 M high-performance variant was released as a 2010 model with a twin-turbocharged V8 producing 555 HP. This generation solidified the X5's position as a benchmark in the luxury SUV segment.
BMW-X5.name: Second Generation (E70)

BMW-X5.description: The E70 received a facelift for the 2011 model year, known as the LCI (Life Cycle Impulse). This refresh updated the styling and technology while maintaining the same platform.
BMW-X5.name: Second Generation (E70) 2011 LCI Facelift

BMW-X5.description: The F15 X5 was first unveiled to the public on 30 May 2013 and officially debuted in November 2013. It refined the formula with a focus on improved efficiency, technology, and luxury. Design became more sophisticated with cleaner lines and more premium details. For the first time, a rear-wheel drive variant (sDrive) was offered alongside xDrive models. Engine options included six and eight-cylinder petrol and diesel units, plus the first plug-in hybrid X5 (xDrive40e). The interior featured higher quality materials and advanced technology including a larger infotainment display, head-up display, and enhanced connectivity. The X5 M continued with a more powerful 567 HP twin-turbo V8. This generation balanced luxury and performance while addressing growing demands for efficiency.
BMW-X5.name: Third Generation (F15)

BMW-X5.description: The current X5 is the fourth generation, unveiled to the public online on 6 June 2018 and officially debuting in November 2018. It is built on BMW's CLAR (Cluster Architecture) platform, featuring increased use of aluminum and high-strength steel for improved dynamics despite larger dimensions. The design evolved with a more prominent kidney grille, slimmer headlights, and more sculpted body sides. All 2019 model year X5s were equipped with xDrive all-wheel drive. An sDrive (rear-wheel drive) variant was added to the US model lineup for 2020. The interior represents a significant step forward with higher quality materials, larger displays, and advanced technology including BMW's latest iDrive system and semi-autonomous driving capabilities. Engine options range from six and eight-cylinder units to the plug-in hybrid xDrive45e with increased electric range, and the performance-focused X5 M delivering up to 617 HP. Throughout its evolution, the X5 has maintained its position as a benchmark in the luxury midsize SUV segment, balancing performance, technology, and luxury.
BMW-X5.name: Fourth Generation (G05)

BMW-X7.description: The BMW X7 is the brand's first full-size, three-row luxury SUV, positioned above the X5 as BMW's flagship SUV model. Built on the CLAR platform, it features imposing dimensions with a length of over 5 meters and a distinctive design characterized by a massive kidney grille, slim vertical headlights, and an upright, boxy profile to maximize interior space. Production started in December 2018 at the BMW US Manufacturing Company plant in Greer, South Carolina, with the X7 becoming available at dealers in March 2019. The interior offers premium appointments with three rows of seats as standard (either in seven-seat configuration or six-seat with second-row captain's chairs), advanced technology including BMW's iDrive 7.0 system, and a dual-panel panoramic sunroof. Engine options vary by market, including six and eight-cylinder petrol and diesel options. All models come standard with air suspension, all-wheel drive (xDrive), and an eight-speed automatic transmission.
BMW-X7.name: First Generation (G07)

BMW-X7.description: The 2022 facelift of the BMW X7 entered production in July 2022 and was launched in August 2022, with model year 2023 marking the introduction of the updated design. The major exterior changes include heavily revised front end design with new horizontally split headlight units (increasing the proportion of the front dedicated to headlights) and an illuminated kidney grille. The interior features a revised curved widescreen dashboard combining digital instruments and infotainment running BMW's latest Operating System 8. A significant mechanical change is that all models from 2023 onwards feature mild hybrid (MHEV) powertrain technology. The updated design is described as very similar to the original first generation design with minimal changes to the side profile and rear, but with a distinctive new face that aligns with BMW's design language seen on the newer 7 Series and i7 models.
BMW-X7.name: First Generation (G07) Facelift

BMW-Z3.description: The BMW Z3 was the company's first mass-produced roadster, initially gaining fame through its appearance in the James Bond film 'GoldenEye' before its market launch. Built at BMW's Spartanburg plant in South Carolina, it was primarily designed for the American market. The roadster (E36/7) launched in September 1995 with 1.8L four-cylinder engines, with 6-cylinder options arriving in 1996, expanding to include various six-cylinder units up to the 3.2L in the M Roadster. The M Roadster was introduced in 1997. In January 1998, the lineup expanded to include the Z3 Coupe (E36/8), featuring distinctive 'shooting brake' styling often referred to as the 'clown shoe' due to its unique profile. The high-performance M Coupe variant featured the same 3.2L engine as the M Roadster. The Z3 combined classic roadster proportions including a long hood and short deck with distinctive BMW design elements like the kidney grille and quad headlights. The pre-facelift interior was relatively spartan but driver-focused. The Z3 established BMW in the premium compact sports car segment, competing with vehicles like the Porsche Boxster and Mercedes-Benz SLK.
BMW-Z3.name: First Generation (E36/7, E36/8) Pre-Facelift

BMW-Z3.description: In April 1999, the Z3 received a comprehensive facelift (LCI) with major visual and technical updates. Exterior changes included redesigned chrome ring headlights, L-shaped taillights replacing the original design, wider rear track (increased by 64mm to match 4-cylinder and 6-cylinder models), new wheel designs, model designation badges, and chrome exhaust tips. Interior updates featured a redesigned centre console with integrated clock, new three-spoke steering wheel, and dual-stage side airbags. Engine lineup was upgraded with the new M54 inline-six replacing the M52 (the '2.0' became '2.2i', '2.8' became '3.0i'). The Z3M models (both roadster and coupe) did not receive these exterior cosmetic changes but continued with their performance focus. Electronic stability control was upgraded from ASC to the new DSC system, later integrated with Dynamic Brake Control (DBC) and Automatic Differential Brake (ADB) functions. A new three-layer insulation convertible roof with headlining was introduced. Production ended June 28, 2002, with the Z3 line replaced by the E85 Z4.
BMW-Z3.name: First Generation (E36/7, E36/8) 1999 Facelift

BMW-Z4.description: The original Z4 replaced the Z3 with more modern, angular 'flame surfacing' design language under the direction of Chris Bangle. Available as a roadster (E85) with a traditional soft top and later as a coupe (E86) with a fixed hardtop, it featured a more premium interior and improved dynamics compared to its predecessor. Engine options ranged from a 2.0L four-cylinder to a 3.2L six-cylinder in the M variants, which produced 338 HP. The Z4 offered a more sophisticated driving experience with enhanced technology and refinement while maintaining focus on driving enjoyment.
BMW-Z4.name: First Generation (E85/E86)

BMW-Z4.description: The second-generation Z4 represented a significant shift with the adoption of a two-piece retractable hardtop, eliminating the need for separate coupe and convertible models. The design became more elegant and less controversial, with smoother surfacing and more traditional proportions. Engine options included four and six-cylinder turbocharged units, with the top-spec sDrive35is producing 335 HP. This generation focused more on grand touring capabilities with improved comfort, refinement, and technology, somewhat shifting away from the raw sportiness of earlier Z models. No M variant was offered for this generation.
BMW-Z4.name: Second Generation (E89)

BMW-Z4.description: The current Z4 returned to a traditional soft top convertible design, developed alongside the Toyota Supra with which it shares a platform and many components. The exterior design features more aggressive, complex surfacing with a wider stance and shorter overhangs. Engine options include four and six-cylinder turbocharged units, with the M40i featuring a 3.0L inline-six producing 382 HP (North American spec). The interior offers BMW's latest technology including digital instrumentation and advanced driver assistance features. This generation attempts to recapture more of the sporting character of the original Z4 while maintaining modern refinement and technology. Unlike its predecessor, no coupe variant is offered, with that role effectively filled by the Toyota Supra.
BMW-Z4.name: Third Generation (G29)

BMW-i3.description: The original BMW i3 generation introduced a groundbreaking electric vehicle that pioneered BMW's dedicated 'i' sub-brand. Built around a purpose-designed architecture featuring a carbon fiber reinforced plastic (CFRP) passenger cell mounted on an aluminum chassis, the i3 prioritized lightweight construction to maximize efficiency and range. The distinctive design featured a tall, narrow body with coach doors, large windows, and a floating dashboard design with sustainable interior materials. Initially launched with a 22 kWh battery (60 Ah) providing approximately 80-100 miles of range, the i3 was available as a pure electric vehicle or with an optional small gasoline range extender engine (REx). Production began in September 2013.
BMW-i3.name: First Generation (I01)

BMW-i3.description: The 2017 model year BMW i3 introduced an enlarged 94 Ah / 33 kWh battery (27.2 kWh net usable), increasing range to approximately 114 miles. The electronics package was upgraded with new software mapping for the battery cooling system and the electric motor. Released in July 2016 for 2017 model year, this update maintained the same platform and exterior design but offered significantly improved range and efficiency.
BMW-i3.name: First Generation (I01) 2017 Update

BMW-i3.description: The exterior was refreshed for the 2018 model year with a new front bumper, horizontal turnsignal light openings, and standard LED headlights. The rear bumper was also revised and a horizontal silver bar was added to the rear hatch. BMW also introduced the i3s sport variant beginning with the 2018 model year, featuring increased power output from 170 to 181 hp, lowered sport suspension, and wider model-exclusive wheels. The i3 maintained the 94 Ah battery from 2017.
BMW-i3.name: First Generation (I01) 2018 Facelift

BMW-i3.description: In September 2018, BMW announced a larger 42.2 kWh (120 Ah) battery for the i3, increasing range to up to 153 miles. Minor alterations included new color options, adaptive headlights, and 429 wheels as standard. With the introduction of the bigger battery, BMW discontinued the Range Extender version in Europe. Production continued until August 2022, with total cumulative production reaching approximately 250,000 units. The i3s continued to be offered with the larger battery throughout this period. US models were discontinued in July 2021 after the 2021 model year, while Australian models ended at the end of 2021.
BMW-i3.name: First Generation (I01) 2019 Update

BMW-i3s.description: The BMW i3s was introduced for the 2018 model year as the sportier variant of the standard i3 electric hatchback. Announced in 2017, the i3s debuted with the first facelift of the i3 platform, featuring refreshed exterior styling including a new front bumper, horizontal turn signal light openings, standard LED headlights, and a revised rear bumper. The i3s was distinguished by more aggressive blacked-out chrome accents compared to the standard i3. The i3s featured a more powerful electric motor producing 181 HP (184 HP later) versus 170 HP in the standard i3, with 199 lb-ft of torque. Visual distinctions included wider fenders with flared wheel arches to accommodate a 40mm wider track, exclusive 20-inch Style 431 double-spoke wheels (20mm wider tires than standard), and a more aggressive stance. The suspension was lowered and sport-tuned for improved handling, with a specific Sport driving mode enhancing throttle response. Available with either a pure battery electric drivetrain or optional range extender gasoline engine, the i3s maintained compatibility with the same 94 Ah / 33 kWh battery system introduced for 2017, with the larger 120 Ah / 42.2 kWh pack becoming standard from 2019 onwards.
BMW-i3s.name: First Generation (I01, 2018-2019)

BMW-i3s.description: The i3s continued production through 2022 with the introduction of the larger 120 Ah / 42.2 kWh battery pack in 2019. This battery provided 153 miles of EPA range, a significant upgrade from the earlier 94 Ah battery's 114-mile range. For the 2019 model year, BMW discontinued the Range Extender (REx) version of the i3 in Europe, though the REx remained available in other markets. The i3s maintained its sport-oriented features including the lowered and sport-tuned suspension, Sport drive mode, and exclusive 20-inch wheels. In June 2021, BMW announced the discontinuation of i3 sales in the US after the 2021 model year, with US production ending in July 2021. Global production of all i3 models, including the i3s, was scheduled to end in July 2022, with a total of 250,000 units produced across both standard i3 and i3s variants from 2013 to 2022. The i3s represented BMW's approach to combining electric vehicle efficiency with traditional driving dynamics and performance characteristics.
BMW-i3s.name: First Generation (I01, 2019-2022)

BMW-i4.description: The BMW i4 (model code G26) is a battery electric compact executive car produced by BMW since October 2021. It is the brand's first all-electric Gran Coupe, based on a modified version of the CLAR platform used for the 4 Series Gran Coupe. Unlike the bespoke platform of the earlier i3, the i4 represents BMW's new approach of offering electric variants within existing model lines. The production version was revealed in March 2021 and went on sale in November 2021 as a 2022 model year. The exterior design closely resembles the conventional 4 Series Gran Coupe, with distinctive blue accents and aerodynamic enhancements identifying it as an electric model. Models introduced at launch include the high-performance M50 with a dual-motor xDrive all-wheel system and eDrive40 with a single rear motor. The i4 M50 is significant as the first all-electric BMW M-branded vehicle. Additional variants were added over time: eDrive35 (August 2022) with 210 kW, eDrive40 with 250 kW single rear motor producing 335 HP, xDrive40 (May 2023) with dual motors producing 396 HP, and M60 variant with 442 kW announced for 2025. The 70.2 kWh or 83.9 kWh (net capacity) battery provides a range of up to 301 miles for the eDrive40 and 270 miles for the M50 (EPA ratings). Inside, the i4 features BMW's curved display combining a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster and 14.9-inch infotainment screen running BMW's iDrive 8 system with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto capability. The vehicle supports DC fast charging at up to 205 kW for the 83.9 kWh models (180 kW for the eDrive35), allowing a 10-80% charge in approximately 31 minutes. The i4 has up to 40 driver assistance systems, enabling Level 2 semi-autonomous driving capability. Production takes place at BMW's Munich plant. The i4 represents BMW's strategy to electrify its core lineup while maintaining brand-characteristic driving dynamics and premium features, serving as the electric equivalent to the BMW 3 Series and 4 Series.
BMW-i4.name: First Generation (G26)

BMW-i5.description: The BMW i5 is the fully electric variant of the 8th generation BMW 5 Series (G60). Production commenced in July 2023 with sales beginning in October 2023. Available as saloon (G60) and Touring (G61) models. Offers three variants: eDrive40 (rear-wheel-drive), xDrive40 (all-wheel-drive), and M60 xDrive (high-performance). The i5 features an 84.3 kWh battery, twin electric motors (dual-motor on xDrive40 and M60 variants), and up to 442 kW of power on the M60. All models share the updated BMW CLAR platform with the G60 5 Series and feature iDrive 8.5 infotainment system.
BMW-i5.name: First Generation

BMW-i8.description: The BMW i8 was a revolutionary plug-in hybrid sports car that served as the halo model for BMW's 'i' sub-brand. The first generation coupe (I12) featured futuristic styling with butterfly doors, a distinctive layered design approach, and advanced aerodynamics. The lightweight construction utilized a carbon fiber reinforced plastic (CFRP) passenger cell mounted on an aluminum chassis. Power came from a hybrid system combining a turbocharged 1.5L three-cylinder engine driving the rear wheels with an electric motor powering the front wheels, providing all-wheel drive capability. The combined system produced 362 PS (357 HP). Performance was impressive with 0-60 mph acceleration in approximately 4.4 seconds, combined with remarkable efficiency for a sports car, achieving approximately 76 MPGe. The electric-only range was about 15 miles (37 km) under EPA/NEDC cycles with a 7.1 kWh lithium-ion battery. Series production began in April 2014, with deliveries to German customers in June 2014 and U.S. customers in August 2014. The interior featured a driver-focused layout with sustainable materials and advanced technology. It was the first production car with laser headlights, reaching farther than LED lights.
BMW-i8.name: First Generation (I12)

BMW-i8.description: The 2018 update of the BMW i8 brought significant technical improvements while maintaining the iconic I12/I15 platform. The battery capacity increased from 7.1 kWh to 11.6 kWh, enabling electric-only range to rise to 55 km (34 miles) for the coupe and 53 km (33 miles) for the roadster. The electric motor output increased by 12 PS to 143 PS, boosting combined system output to 374 PS (369 HP). In May 2018, the long-anticipated roadster variant (I15) was launched with deliveries beginning in May 2018, featuring a two-seat open-top configuration with an electric two-piece folding roof. Both coupe and roadster variants featured the same enhanced powertrain and were produced until June 2020 when the entire i8 line ended production after approximately 20,465 total units (16,581 coupes and 3,884 roadsters). The i8 left a legacy as one of the most distinctive and innovative vehicles in BMW's history, pioneering technologies and construction methods that influenced later models.
BMW-i8.name: First Generation (I12/I15) - 2018 Update

BMW-iX.description: The BMW iX is the brand's flagship electric SUV, built on a dedicated electric vehicle platform featuring an aluminum spaceframe and carbon cage construction with extensive use of carbon fiber reinforced plastic (CFRP). Its controversial exterior design incorporates a large, blanked-off kidney grille (housing cameras and sensors), slim LED headlights, flush door handles, and aerodynamically optimized styling elements. The iX is available in multiple variants, including the xDrive40 with 322 HP, xDrive50 with 516 HP, and high-performance M60 with 610 HP. All versions feature dual-motor all-wheel drive. Battery capacity ranges from 71 kWh (net) in the xDrive40 to 105.2 kWh in the xDrive50 and M60, providing EPA-rated ranges of up to 324 miles. The interior represents a significant departure from traditional BMW design, featuring a minimalist approach with a hexagonal steering wheel, floating curved display combining digital instruments and infotainment, and sustainable materials. Advanced technology includes BMW's iDrive 8 system, augmented reality navigation, and Level 2+ driver assistance capabilities. The iX supports DC fast charging at up to 195 kW, allowing a 10-80% charge in as little as 35 minutes. As BMW's technology flagship, the iX showcases the brand's fifth-generation eDrive technology and sets the direction for future electric BMW models with its combination of performance, range, and innovation.
BMW-iX.name: First Generation (I20)

BMW-iX3.description: The BMW iX3 is the brand's first all-electric SUV, based on the conventional X3 (G01) platform rather than a dedicated EV architecture. This approach represents BMW's flexible strategy allowing production of combustion engine, plug-in hybrid, and fully electric vehicles on the same production line. The exterior design largely mirrors the standard X3 with unique aerodynamic wheels, blue accents, and a blanked-off kidney grille identifying it as an electric model. Unlike some competitors, the iX3 features a single rear-mounted electric motor producing 282 HP (210 kW) and 400 Nm of torque, making it rear-wheel drive rather than all-wheel drive. The 80 kWh battery (net capacity: 73.83 kWh usable) provides a WLTP range of up to 460 km (286 miles). The iX3 supports DC fast charging at up to 150 kW, allowing a 0-80% charge in 34 minutes and adding 100 km of range in 10 minutes. Inside, the interior closely resembles the standard X3 with the addition of blue accents and EV-specific displays. The iX3 features BMW's fifth-generation eDrive technology with a more energy-dense battery and motor system that would later be used in vehicles like the i4 and iX. Production began in September 2020 at BMW's factory in Dadong, Shenyang, China. The iX3 was not available in North America due to market-specific requirements and its rear-wheel-drive configuration. It was replaced by the second-generation iX3 (NA5) in 2025, which uses the new Neue Klasse platform.
BMW-iX3.name: First Generation (G08)

BYD-Atto-3.description: The BYD Atto 3 (marketed as Yuan Plus in China and Latin America) is a battery electric compact crossover SUV built on BYD's dedicated e-Platform 3.0. Production began in January 2022. The vehicle features a distinctive design with sharp character lines, a closed-off front grille, connected LED light bars, and flush door handles for aerodynamics. It is powered by BYD's proprietary Blade Battery technology with LFP (lithium iron phosphate) chemistry, available with either a 49.92 kWh or 60.48 kWh battery pack. A front-mounted permanent magnet synchronous electric motor produces 150 kW (201 HP) standard power and 310 Nm of torque, enabling 0-100 km/h acceleration in approximately 7.3 seconds. The vehicle features a rotating 12.8-inch (or optional 15.6-inch from 2024) central infotainment touchscreen based on Android that can switch between portrait and landscape orientations, fitness-inspired interior design elements, and comprehensive driver assistance features. The Atto 3 was first showcased in August 2021 at the Chengdu Auto Show and officially released in February 2022 in China. It represents BYD's global expansion strategy, being introduced to multiple international markets including Europe, Australia, Japan, Southeast Asia, and beyond as BYD establishes itself in the worldwide EV market.
BYD-Atto-3.name: First Generation

BYD-Dolphin-Mini.description: The BYD Seagull (marketed as Dolphin Mini in Latin America, Dolphin Surf in Europe, and Atto 1 in Australia/Asia-Pacific) is a battery electric city car (A-segment) produced by BYD Auto since April 2023. Positioned below the BYD Dolphin, it is currently the smallest BYD vehicle. Built on BYD's e-Platform 3.0 with model code EQ, it measures 3.78 meters in length with a wheelbase of 2.5 meters. The exterior combines sharp lines and angular headlights with a sloping roofline and rear light bar following BYD's Ocean Series design language. The minimalist interior features a rotatable 10.1-inch touchscreen and 5-inch digital instrument cluster. It is equipped with BYD Blade battery technology (LFP chemistry) in 30.08 kWh or 38.88 kWh capacities, with CLTC ranges of 305 km and 405 km respectively. A single permanent magnet synchronous motor produces 55 kW (75 HP) and 180 Nm of torque. The Seagull gained significant attention for its extremely competitive pricing—starting below CN¥90,000 (approximately US$12,000)—making it one of the most affordable purpose-built electric vehicles on the market. Upon launch, BYD received 10,000 orders in 24 hours, and the 200,000th unit rolled off the assembly line by November 2023.
BYD-Dolphin-Mini.name: First Generation

BYD-Dolphin-Mini.description: In March 2024, BYD introduced the Seagull Honor Edition as the 2024 model year variant with a five percent price reduction in China. This update introduced new body color options including Ice Blue with Sea Blue interior, but maintained the same platform, powertrain, and core specifications of the original generation.
BYD-Dolphin-Mini.name: First Generation (2024 Update)

BYD-Dolphin-Mini.description: In February 2025, the Seagull received a significant update with revised front and rear bumper design, updated interior elements, and the addition of BYD's God's Eye C and DiPilot 100 advanced driver assistance systems as standard. The European market variant introduced as Dolphin Surf received increased length to 3.99 meters to accommodate revised front and rear crash structures. The updated model maintains the same e-Platform 3.0 base and battery options but with enhanced styling and technology features.
BYD-Dolphin-Mini.name: First Generation (2025 Facelift)

BYD-Sealion-6.description: The first generation BYD Sealion 6 (marketed as BYD Song Plus in China) was introduced in September 2020 as a larger and more upmarket alternative to the BYD Song Pro, positioned in the compact SUV segment. Available in plug-in hybrid DM-i and battery electric EV variants. The pre-facelift model features the original front end and rear end design with a 12.8-inch rotatable central infotainment screen with the third-generation DiLink system. DM-i variants include 51 km and 110 km electric range options with an 8.3 kWh or 18.3 kWh LFP Blade battery. The EV variant is equipped with a 71.7 kWh LFP Blade battery providing a CLTC range of up to 520 km.
BYD-Sealion-6.name: First Generation (Pre-facelift)

BYD-Sealion-6.description: The 2023 facelift was launched in June 2023 for the Chinese market as the Song Plus Champion Edition, featuring a restyled front end and rear end design with headlamp units similar to the BYD Seal. The BYD logo replaced the Song emblem, aligning it with Ocean series vehicles. Exported to Europe as the BYD Seal U (September 2023) and to other markets as the BYD Sealion 6 (from May 2024 onwards). Available in DM-i plug-in hybrid and EV variants. DM-i versions include 75 km, 112 km, and 160 km electric range options with various battery sizes (12.9-26.6 kWh). EV variants offer 520 km and 605 km CLTC range options. In 2024 and 2025, extended range battery options were introduced for both DM-i and EV variants, expanding the available electric range configurations.
BYD-Sealion-6.name: First Generation (2023 Facelift)

Bentley-Bentayga.description: The original Bentley Bentayga was the brand's first SUV, launched in December 2015, built on the Volkswagen Group MLB Evo platform shared with the Audi Q7 and Porsche Cayenne. It debuted with a 6.0L twin-turbo W12 engine producing 600 HP. The lineup expanded to include a 4.0L twin-turbo V8 petrol (2018), a 4.0L twin-turbo diesel V8 (2017), and a V6 PHEV (2019). The Bentayga featured Bentley's renowned craftsmanship with an ultra-luxurious interior and was available in four, five, or seven-seat configurations. Special editions included the Bentayga Speed with a 626 HP W12 engine. A total of 608 First Edition units were produced at launch.
Bentley-Bentayga.name: First Generation

Bentley-Bentayga.description: Released in June 2020, the facelifted Bentayga features a complete exterior redesign inspired by the Continental GT and Flying Spur. Key changes include 3D elliptical tail-lights with animated LEDs, new side vents, enlarged rear spoiler, repositioned number plate, and new wheel designs. The interior received a major update with a new 10.9-inch touchscreen infotainment system, digital instrument cluster replacing traditional dials, wireless smartphone charging, and enhanced rear seating with 100mm increase in knee space. Rear passengers receive a 5.0-inch touchscreen tablet for climate and entertainment control. Powertrain options include the 6.0L W12 (standard and Speed variant at 635 HP), 4.0L twin-turbo V8 (542 HP), and V6 PHEV. Additional variants introduced post-facelift include the Bentayga S (May 2021, sportier V8 version), Bentayga Azure (May 2022, comfort-oriented), and Bentayga EWB (May 2022, extended wheelbase intended to replace the Bentley Mulsanne).
Bentley-Bentayga.name: First Generation (Facelift)

Buick-Encore.description: The first-generation Buick Encore was a subcompact luxury crossover SUV based on the GM Gamma II platform shared with the Chevrolet Trax. It debuted at the 2012 North American International Auto Show and went on sale at the end of 2012. The initial models featured a 1.4L A14NET turbocharged four-cylinder engine rated at 128 HP coupled to a 6-speed automatic transmission, available in front-wheel drive or all-wheel drive. The Encore was offered in Base, Convenience, Leather, and Premium trim levels. The exterior featured a compact profile well-suited for urban environments, and the interior emphasized premium features unusual for its size class, including active noise cancellation and available leather seating.
Buick-Encore.name: First Generation (2013-2016)

Buick-Encore.description: For 2017, the Buick Encore received a significant refresh that updated exterior styling with revised headlights and bumpers, LED tail lights, and a new VentiPorts design. The interior was redesigned with a revised dash and gauge cluster featuring a 4.2-inch information screen, revised center stack, and updated infotainment system with an 8-inch frameless screen with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility. The 2016 model year introduced the more powerful B14XFT 1.4L Ecotec turbo engine rated at 153 HP, which became available across the lineup during this facelift period. Starting with the 2020 model year, all trims except the Preferred were discontinued as GM introduced the larger Encore GX. The first-generation Encore remained in production through 2022, when it was discontinued.
Buick-Encore.name: First Generation (2017 Facelift)

Buick-Encore.description: The second-generation Buick Encore was revealed at the 2019 Shanghai Auto Show and available for model years 2020-2022. Built on the GM GEM platform (intended for emerging markets), the second generation featured a new design with 1.0L B10XFT 3-cylinder turbo (92 HP) or 1.3L L3T 3-cylinder turbo (121 HP) engines with either a 6-speed automatic or CVT transmission. The second-generation Encore was not exported to North America and was sold exclusively in China, where it replaced the first-generation model. As of July 2023, the Encore is no longer listed on Buick China's website.
Buick-Encore.name: Second Generation

Buick-Encore-GX.description: The first-generation Buick Encore GX is a subcompact luxury crossover built on the GM VSS-F platform (9BXX), positioned between the smaller Encore and larger Envision in Buick's lineup. Despite sharing the Encore name, it is a completely different vehicle than the original Encore. Power comes from either a 1.2L turbocharged three-cylinder engine producing 137 HP or a 1.3L turbocharged three-cylinder with 155 HP, paired with either a CVT (front-wheel drive) or nine-speed automatic (all-wheel drive) transmission. The interior features premium materials, an 8-inch infotainment display with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, and up to 50.2 cubic feet of cargo space with the rear seats folded. Safety technology includes standard automatic emergency braking, lane-keeping assist, and available adaptive cruise control.
Buick-Encore-GX.name: First Generation (2020-2023)

Buick-Encore-GX.description: The 2024 Encore GX received a comprehensive facelift unveiled in 2023, adopting Buick's new Pure Design philosophy and updated corporate emblem. The exterior features bold, more upscale styling with a sleeker profile, forward-leaning front end, sharp character lines, and distinctive wraparound lighting elements. The interior was refreshed with a more premium appearance featuring a 'Virtual Cockpit' composed of an 8-inch digital instrument cluster and 11-inch infotainment touchscreen in a single panel. The powertrain continued with the 1.3L turbocharged three-cylinder engine producing 155 HP and 174 lb-ft of torque, paired with a CVT for front-wheel drive models or a 9-speed automatic for all-wheel drive variants. Trim levels changed with the base Preferred, mid-level ST, and luxury-oriented Avenir. The facelift brought improved technology with wireless device charging, enhanced driver assistance systems, and Buick's QuietTuning sound insulation features.
Buick-Encore-GX.name: First Generation (2024 Facelift)

Buick-Envision.description: The first-generation Buick Envision was a compact luxury crossover initially launched in China in August 2014 (October on-sale date) before being introduced to North America in 2016. Built on GM's D2XX (Delta II) platform, it slotted between the subcompact Encore and the larger Enclave in Buick's lineup. In North America, it was powered by a 2.0L turbocharged four-cylinder engine producing 252 HP and 260 lb-ft of torque, paired with a six-speed automatic transmission and standard all-wheel drive. A 2.5L naturally aspirated four-cylinder with 197 HP and 192 lb-ft torque was added as a more affordable option. The interior featured premium appointments including available leather seating, heated/ventilated front seats, and an 8-inch infotainment system. The Envision was initially offered with all-wheel drive only in 2016, with optional front-wheel drive added for model year 2017. The North American version was sold from 2016-2018 (pre-facelift) with Premium I and Premium II trim levels initially, expanding to five trim levels for 2017.
Buick-Envision.name: First Generation

Buick-Envision.description: The 2019 Envision facelift debuted in late 2017 in China and in 2018 for the North American market. It features revised rear styling and tail lights, revised seating design, and stop/start calibration updates. For the North American market, the transmission for the 2.0-liter turbo engine was upgraded to a 9-speed automatic. This facelift represented mid-generation visual and technological refinements while maintaining the same D2XX platform. The 2019 facelift continued the 20T and 28T trim naming convention with updated technology and styling.
Buick-Envision.name: First Generation (2019 Facelift)

Buick-Envision.description: The second-generation Envision was introduced in May 2020 and launched for the 2021 model year in North America. Built on GM's E2XX platform (shared with Cadillac XT4), it features more athletic styling with a lower, wider stance and sharper design elements aligned with Buick's modern design language. It is powered by a 2.0L turbocharged four-cylinder engine producing 228 HP and 258 lb-ft of torque, paired with a nine-speed automatic transmission. Available in front-wheel or all-wheel drive configurations, the new Envision emphasizes technology with a standard 10.2-inch touchscreen (on higher trims), wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, and enhanced driver assistance features including blind spot monitor, lane departure warning, and forward collision alert. Four trim levels are offered: base, Preferred, Essence, and Avenir (Buick's premium trim with unique styling, quilted leather seats, navigation, and driver assistance technology package). The interior quality saw significant improvements with more premium materials and a driver-focused cockpit design.
Buick-Envision.name: Second Generation

Buick-Envision.description: The Envision received a facelift for the 2024 model year with front design changes and new dashboard-mounted digital displays. This refresh maintains the E2XX platform while updating the styling and interior technology. The 2024 refresh continues the same 2.0L turbocharged four-cylinder engine (228 HP, 258 lb-ft torque) and 9-speed automatic transmission. Super Cruise autonomous driving was planned but not realized due to delays in its broader launch.
Buick-Envision.name: Second Generation (2024 Refresh)

Buick-LaCrosse.description: The original Buick LaCrosse (known as the Allure in Canada) replaced the Century and Regal in North America as Buick's mid-size sedan. Built on GM's W-body platform, it featured conservative styling aimed at traditional Buick customers. Engine options included a 3.8L V6 producing 200 HP and a more powerful 3.6L V6 with 240 HP. The interior emphasized comfort with spacious seating, wood trim, and a quiet cabin. Though not sport-oriented, a Super variant was added in 2008 with a 5.3L V8 producing 300 HP. This generation established the LaCrosse nameplate but maintained Buick's traditional approach to the mid-size luxury segment.
Buick-LaCrosse.name: First Generation

Buick-LaCrosse.description: The second-generation LaCrosse represented a significant modernization for Buick, with more contemporary styling influenced by the Invicta concept car. Built on GM's Epsilon II platform, it featured a sleeker profile and more upscale appearance. Engine options included a 2.4L four-cylinder with eAssist mild-hybrid system and a 3.6L V6 producing up to 303 HP. Front-wheel drive was standard with all-wheel drive available on V6 models. The interior saw major improvements in design, material quality, and technology features. A refresh in 2014 updated the styling and technology offerings. This generation helped reposition Buick as a more modern premium brand and attracted younger buyers to the nameplate.
Buick-LaCrosse.name: Second Generation

Buick-LaCrosse.description: The final generation of the LaCrosse featured the most sophisticated design and technology in the model's history. Built on GM's P2XX platform, it was larger yet lighter than its predecessor thanks to increased use of high-strength steel and other weight-saving measures. The exterior adopted a more dynamic appearance with a lower roofline and longer wheelbase. Initially powered by a 3.6L V6 with 310 HP or a 2.5L four-cylinder with eAssist mild-hybrid technology, all models featured a new 9-speed automatic transmission. The interior offered premium materials, improved infotainment technology, and advanced driver assistance features. Despite its improvements, declining sedan sales led to the LaCrosse's discontinuation in North America after 2019 as Buick shifted focus to its crossover lineup, though the model continued in the Chinese market.
Buick-LaCrosse.name: Third Generation

Cadillac-CT4.description: The Cadillac CT4 is a compact luxury sedan that replaced the ATS in Cadillac's lineup. Built on GM's Alpha platform with a rear-wheel drive layout (all-wheel drive optional), it features Cadillac's Art & Science design language with distinctive vertical lighting elements, sharp creases, and a fastback-like profile. The base engine is a 2.0L turbocharged four-cylinder producing 237 HP, while the CT4-V sport model features a 2.7L turbocharged four-cylinder with 325 HP. The high-performance CT4-V Blackwing, introduced in 2022, is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.6L V6 delivering 472 HP, available with either a 6-speed manual or 10-speed automatic transmission. The CT4 went on sale in Q2 2020 and production will end in June 2026.
Cadillac-CT4.name: First Generation

Cadillac-CT5.description: The Cadillac CT5 is a mid-size luxury sedan that replaced the CTS in Cadillac's lineup. Built on GM's Alpha 2 platform with a rear-wheel drive layout (all-wheel drive optional), it features a fastback-inspired design with a longer, lower profile than its predecessor. The standard powertrain is a 2.0L turbocharged four-cylinder producing 237 HP, while Premium Luxury models offer an optional 3.0L twin-turbocharged V6 with 335 HP. The sport-oriented CT5-V increases the V6's output to 360 HP, while the high-performance CT5-V Blackwing, introduced in 2022, features a supercharged 6.2L V8 producing 668 HP, available with either a 6-speed manual or 10-speed automatic transmission. The interior offers a driver-focused cockpit with a 10-inch touchscreen, available digital instrument cluster, and premium materials including carbon fiber, leather, and real wood trim options. Technology features include wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, while the Super Cruise semi-autonomous driving system is available on higher trims.
Cadillac-CT5.name: First Generation

Cadillac-CT5.description: The 2025 Cadillac CT5 facelift debuted at the 2023 North American International Detroit Auto Show and was launched in China in December 2023. This facelift features a restyled facia and interior updates while maintaining the same GM Alpha 2 platform and powertrain options (2.0L turbocharged I4, 3.0L twin-turbocharged V6, and supercharged 6.2L V8 in the CT5-V Blackwing). The updated design represents a refresh of the exterior styling, including new headlights, grille, and bumper design, along with enhanced interior appointments featuring a 33-inch display in the cabin. The CT5 continues to offer multiple trim levels and performance variants, competing directly with European luxury sedans.
Cadillac-CT5.name: First Generation (2025 Facelift)

Cadillac-CTS.description: The original Cadillac CTS was a pivotal model that introduced the brand's Art & Science design language, featuring sharp angles and distinctive vertical lighting elements. Built on GM's Sigma platform with a rear-wheel drive layout, it marked Cadillac's return to the compact luxury sport sedan segment to compete with German rivals. Initially powered by a 3.2L V6 producing 220 HP (later replaced by a 3.6L V6 with 255 HP), paired with either a 5-speed manual or automatic transmission. The high-performance CTS-V variant was introduced in 2004, featuring a 5.7L LS6 V8 from the Corvette Z06 producing 400 HP. The interior featured a blend of traditional luxury elements with modern technological features, though material quality received some criticism. The first-generation CTS helped redefine Cadillac's image as a more dynamic, contemporary luxury brand.
Cadillac-CTS.name: First Generation

Cadillac-CTS.description: The second-generation CTS grew in size, refinement, and performance, moving more firmly into the mid-size luxury segment. Built on an enhanced version of the Sigma platform (Sigma II), it featured more sophisticated styling while maintaining the Art & Science design elements. Engine options expanded to include a 3.0L V6 with 270 HP, a 3.6L V6 with 304 HP, and in 2010, a 3.6L twin-turbo V6 producing 556 HP in the CTS-V. The lineup expanded to include coupe (2011-2014) and wagon (2010-2014) body styles, with the striking coupe particularly enhancing Cadillac's design credentials. The interior saw significant improvements in material quality, design, and technology. The second-generation CTS, particularly the CTS-V, received critical acclaim for its performance and handling, helping establish Cadillac's credibility in the performance luxury segment. The second-generation CTS-V was marketed through 2014, concurrent with the third generation standard sedan.
Cadillac-CTS.name: Second Generation

Cadillac-CTS.description: The final generation of the CTS moved further upmarket to compete directly with the BMW 5 Series and Mercedes-Benz E-Class. Built on GM's new Alpha platform, it was lighter and more agile than its predecessor despite increased dimensions. Engine options included a turbocharged 2.0L four-cylinder with 272 HP, a 3.6L V6 with 335 HP, and a twin-turbocharged 3.6L V6 producing 420 HP in the CTS Vsport. The CTS-V featured a supercharged 6.2L V8 delivering 640 HP, making it one of the most powerful sedans in the world at its launch. The interior offered sophisticated design, premium materials, and advanced technology including Cadillac's CUE infotainment system. While critically acclaimed for its driving dynamics and performance, the third-generation CTS faced sales challenges in a market increasingly shifting toward SUVs. It was discontinued after 2019 and effectively replaced by the CT5 in Cadillac's lineup.
Cadillac-CTS.name: Third Generation

Cadillac-ELR.description: The Cadillac ELR was a luxury plug-in hybrid coupe based on the first-generation Chevrolet Volt's extended-range electric vehicle (EREV) platform. Featuring striking, angular design inspired by the Cadillac Converj concept car, it showcased Cadillac's Art & Science design language with dramatic proportions and distinctive vertical lighting elements. The powertrain combined a 1.4L four-cylinder gasoline engine with an electric motor and a 16.5 kWh lithium-ion battery, providing 37 miles of electric-only range before the gasoline generator engaged to extend range to about 340 miles total. The system produced 217 HP and 295 lb-ft of torque. The interior featured premium materials including leather, suede microfiber, chrome, and real wood accents, with Cadillac's CUE infotainment system as standard. The 2014 ELR had a base price of $75,000, but due to slow early sales, the 2015 model year was skipped. The ELR struggled in the market due to its high launch price and limited practicality with a tight rear seat.
Cadillac-ELR.name: First Generation

Cadillac-ELR.description: The 2016 Cadillac ELR received a significant update with increased horsepower from 217 to 233 HP and peak torque from 295 to 373 lb-ft, reducing the zero-to-60 time by 1.5 seconds. The 2016 model featured enhanced suspension with stiffer springs, stiffer control-arm bushings, and a damper rebound spring to mitigate torque-steer. Brakes were upgraded with Brembo performance components available as an option. The all-electric range was improved from 37 to 39 miles with an updated 17.1 kWh lithium-ion battery. The 2016 ELR included previously optional safety features as standard: blind-spot monitoring, rear cross-traffic alert, automatic high beams, and lane-change alert. A new 4G LTE onboard connection with Wi-Fi hotspot capability was added, along with Cadillac's revised wreathless crest badge and revised front grille. The MSRP was reduced by $10,000 to approximately $65,000, but production ended in February 2016 after only one model year. The ELR represented Cadillac's first attempt at an electrified luxury vehicle, with total production of approximately 2,958 units sold across both generations (2,874 in the U.S., 84 in Canada).
Cadillac-ELR.name: First Generation (2016 Facelift)

Cadillac-Escalade.description: The original Cadillac Escalade was hastily developed as a response to the Lincoln Navigator, essentially a rebadged GMC Yukon Denali with minimal Cadillac-specific styling elements. Based on the GMT400 truck platform, it featured a 5.7L V8 engine producing 255 HP, paired with a four-speed automatic transmission and standard four-wheel drive. The interior offered leather seating for up to seven passengers and upscale features for its time, though much was shared with other GM SUVs. Despite its rushed development and limited differentiation, the first Escalade established Cadillac in the luxury SUV segment and set the foundation for what would become the brand's most recognized model.
Cadillac-Escalade.name: First Generation

Cadillac-Escalade.description: After skipping the 2001 model year, the completely redesigned second-generation Escalade emerged with distinctive Cadillac styling featuring the brand's Art & Science design language. Based on the GMT800 platform, it offered three body styles: the standard model, the extended ESV, and the unique EXT pickup truck variant. Power came from a 5.3L V8 (AWD models) or a more powerful 6.0L V8 (RWD models and later all variants) producing up to 345 HP. The significantly upgraded interior featured higher quality materials and advanced technology including navigation and DVD entertainment systems. This generation cemented the Escalade's cultural impact, becoming an icon in music, sports, and entertainment while elevating Cadillac's image with younger buyers.
Cadillac-Escalade.name: Second Generation

Cadillac-Escalade.description: The third-generation Escalade refined the formula with more sophisticated styling, improved quality, and enhanced performance. Built on the GMT900 platform, it featured a 6.2L V8 engine producing 403 HP, later upgraded to 420 HP. All models featured a six-speed automatic transmission with available all-wheel drive. The interior offered further improvements in material quality and technology, including a sophisticated audio system, power-folding third-row seats, and a then-advanced navigation system. This generation continued the Escalade's position as a status symbol while offering genuine luxury features and commanding road presence.
Cadillac-Escalade.name: Third Generation

Cadillac-Escalade.description: The fourth-generation Escalade featured more differentiation from its Chevrolet and GMC siblings, with distinct exterior styling and a significantly upgraded interior. Built on the K2XX platform, it continued with a 6.2L V8 now producing 420 HP, paired with either a six-speed (later eight-speed, then ten-speed) automatic transmission. The interior was dominated by the Cadillac User Experience (CUE) infotainment system with a large touchscreen and capacitive controls. Notable technology included magnetic ride control suspension, a head-up display, and advanced driver assistance features. This generation maintained the Escalade's status as Cadillac's flagship while advancing its technology and luxury credentials.
Cadillac-Escalade.name: Fourth Generation

Cadillac-Escalade.description: The fifth-generation Escalade debuted on February 4, 2020, for the 2021 model year, built on GM's GMT T1XX platform with an independent rear suspension for the first time. The exterior featured evolutionary styling with distinctive vertical lighting elements, while the interior showcased groundbreaking technology including a curved OLED display spanning 38 inches across the dashboard. Powertrain options included a standard 6.2L V8 producing 420 HP, a 3.0L turbodiesel inline-six with 277 HP, and for the Escalade-V performance variant, a supercharged 6.2L V8 delivering 682 HP. Technology highlights included available Super Cruise hands-free driving capability, AKG 36-speaker audio system, and augmented reality navigation. This generation combined traditional Escalade presence and luxury with cutting-edge technology and improved driving dynamics.
Cadillac-Escalade.name: Fifth Generation

Cadillac-Escalade.description: The 2025 facelift was revealed on July 17, 2024, representing a significant mid-generation refresh. The exterior changes include a new front fascia with vertical headlights borrowed from the Escalade IQ, new illuminated crest logo on the grille, new illuminated grille surround, and new taillights with revised bumper. Interior redesign features a curved 55-inch display integrating both driver and passenger displays (upgraded from the previous 38-inch OLED), new secondary lower screen for vehicle settings, new steering wheel, and column-mounted shifter. New features include Executive Second Row package with center console, rear command center, optional second-row massage seats, and dual 12.6-inch touchscreen displays. The diesel engine option was discontinued for the facelift. Super Cruise became a standard feature for the first three years. The Escalade-V variant maintains 682 horsepower. This facelift reaffirms the Escalade's position as Cadillac's flagship vehicle with the most advanced technology available.
Cadillac-Escalade.name: Fifth Generation (2025 Facelift)

Cadillac-LYRIQ.description: The Cadillac LYRIQ is Cadillac's first all-electric vehicle, built on GM's BEV3 platform. Production began in May 2022 with the 2023 model year. The initial launch configuration features a single rear-mounted electric motor producing 340 HP and 325 lb-ft of torque. The 102 kWh Ultium battery pack delivers an EPA-estimated range of 312-314 miles in rear-wheel drive form. For the 2024 model year, a dual-motor all-wheel drive version became available with approximately 500 HP output. The exterior design features a distinctive black crystal grille with illuminated elements, ultra-thin vertical LED headlights and taillights, and a fastback-like profile. A more conventional door access system with remote-activated flush pop-out handles was introduced for 2024. Inside, the cabin showcases a minimalist luxury aesthetic dominated by a 33-inch curved LED display integrating the instrument cluster and infotainment system. Advanced technology includes Super Cruise hands-free driving capability and up to 190 kW DC fast charging.
Cadillac-LYRIQ.name: First Generation

Cadillac-LYRIQ.description: The 2025 Cadillac LYRIQ receives a comprehensive refresh while maintaining the BEV3 platform foundation. The base Tech trim level was dropped, and the model is redesigned with 24% fewer parts. Power output increases to 365 HP for rear-wheel drive (up from 340 HP) and 515 HP for all-wheel drive (up from 500 HP). EPA-estimated range increases to 326 miles for rear-wheel drive models. The Velocity Package, a $1,200 OTA update, increases torque output further and reduces 0-60 times from 4.7 to 4.4 seconds for dual-motor models. In January 2025, Cadillac introduced the high-performance Lyriq-V variant as a 2026 model, featuring 615 HP and accelerating from 0-60 mph in 3.3 seconds, though with a slightly reduced EPA-estimated range of 285 miles.
Cadillac-LYRIQ.name: First Generation (2025 Refresh)

Cadillac-XT5.description: The Cadillac XT5 (Crossover Touring 5) is a compact luxury crossover SUV manufactured by General Motors. It replaced the Cadillac SRX when launched in early 2016. Built on GM's C1XX platform, it features Cadillac's Art & Science design language with crisp lines and distinctive vertical lighting elements. Initially powered exclusively by a 3.6L V6 engine producing 310 HP paired with an eight-speed automatic transmission. Both front-wheel drive and all-wheel drive configurations are available. The interior features a driver-focused design with premium materials including leather, aluminum, and real wood accents, with Cadillac's CUE infotainment system. Technology features include a streaming video rear-view mirror, 360-degree camera system, and driver assistance features. Manufactured at GM's Spring Hill Manufacturing plant in Tennessee, with Chinese-market variants produced in Shanghai by SAIC-GM.
Cadillac-XT5.name: First Generation

Cadillac-XT5.description: For the 2020 model year, the XT5 received significant mid-cycle updates. The trim levels changed to Cadillac's Y strategy with Luxury as the base, Premium Luxury, and Sport as higher levels. The exterior received minor design changes with new grille treatments on different trims. Most notably, GM's 2.0L turbocharged I4 engine producing 237 HP and 258 lbft torque replaced the previous engine in China and became the new base engine in North America, joining the V6 option. A new rotary controller for the Cadillac CUE infotainment system was added, along with updates to the rear camera mirror and electronic precision shifter. The ninth-speed Hydramatic 9T65 transmission replaced the previous eight-speed unit. This generation remains on the C1XX platform.
Cadillac-XT5.name: First Generation (2020 Facelift)

Cadillac-XT5.description: The second generation Cadillac XT5 was unveiled in China in August 2024 and represents a full redesign. Built on GM's new VSS-S platform (C1-2), featuring updated exterior styling and increased dimensions compared to the first generation. The interior features a 33-inch curved instrument cluster-infotainment combination display, semi-aniline leather seating, wood and aluminum trim, and a floating center console with air-cooled 15W wireless charging. Technology includes 126-color ambient lighting, panoramic sunroof, 9.3-inch digital rearview mirror, and 15-speaker AKG audio system with adaptive high-beam headlights. Powered by a 2.0L turbocharged I4 48V mild hybrid system producing 227 HP, driving through a nine-speed automatic transmission and optional twin-clutch all-wheel drive system. As of 2024, manufacturing is centered in Shanghai, China by Shanghai GM.
Cadillac-XT5.name: Second Generation

Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.description: The initial version of the second-generation Chery Tiggo 7/7 Pro, codenamed T1E and introduced in March 2020 in China and September 2020 in Russia. This version features the base interior and exterior design before the Tiggo 7 Plus update, with engine options including a 1.5L turbocharged engine (230T) paired with CVT transmission, and a 1.6L turbocharged engine (290T) with 7-speed DCT transmission. Front-wheel drive and all-wheel drive layouts are available in select markets. Known as Tiggo 7 Pro in export markets including Russia, Indonesia, Philippines, South Africa, and other regions.
Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.name: Second Generation (2020-2021)

Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.description: The Tiggo 7 Plus variant launched in China on 27 September 2021, with updated exterior design featuring a redesigned front fascia and slightly updated rear taillights. The interior includes an updated dashboard with Chery's Lion 4.0 operating system featuring Baidu CarLife and Apple CarPlay integration. This version introduces a mild hybrid (MHEV) powertrain option combining the 1.5L turbocharged engine with a 48-volt lithium-ion battery system. In select export markets, the Plus exterior design was adopted for the global-market Tiggo 7 Pro. The 1.6L turbocharged engine (290T) with 7-speed DCT remains available.
Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.name: Second Generation (2021 Plus) (2021-2022)

Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.description: The 2023 model year facelift introduced in two versions: the China-exclusive Tiggo 7 Plus with a completely redesigned front end using headlights from the Tiggo 8 Plus, and the global Tiggo 7 Pro Max/Pro e+ version with the exterior design from the 2021 Plus models featuring a redesigned front bumper and updated grille. Both versions feature updated interior design and introduce a plug-in hybrid (PHEV) powertrain option combining the 1.5L turbocharged engine with a permanent-magnet synchronous motor and 3-speed DHT transmission. Export markets including Russia, Australia, Indonesia, Malaysia, South Africa, and Mexico receive this generation with various prefixes (Pro Max, Pro e+, CSH depending on market).
Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.name: Second Generation (2023 Facelift) (2023-2024)

Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.description: The second facelift revealed in April 2024 for the 2025 model year, borrowing the exterior design from the facelifted 2023 Plus models but featuring a newly-redesigned front bumper, grille and rear fascia. Sales commenced in China on 1 November 2024 as the Tiggo 7 Plus. Global export versions continued as Tiggo 7 Pro Max and CSH (Chery Super Hybrid) variants in various markets including Australia, Malaysia, South Africa, Spain (as Ebro S700), Russia, and others. Engine options remain consistent with previous generations, including the 1.5L and 1.6L turbocharged petrol engines, with the PHEV option providing 80-93 km electric-only range depending on market specification.
Chery-Tiggo-7-Pro.name: Second Generation (2025 Facelift) (2025-present)

Chery-Tiggo-8.description: The Chery Tiggo 8 is a mid-size crossover SUV that serves as the flagship of Chery's SUV lineup. First introduced in 2017 and revealed at the 2018 Beijing Auto Show, it is positioned between the smaller Chery Tiggo 7 and the larger Chery Tiggo 9. The first generation rides on a unibody chassis with MacPherson struts in front and multi-link rear suspension. It features a bold front fascia with a large hexagonal grille and sleek LED headlights. The initial models are powered by a 1.5L inline-four turbocharged petrol engine producing 108 kW (145 HP) and 210 Nm of torque, mated to a 6-speed dual-clutch transmission. For the 2019 model year, a 1.6L turbocharged petrol engine (290T variant) with 145 kW (197 HP) and 290 Nm of torque was added, paired with a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission. The interior offers three rows of seating for up to seven passengers with a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system. The wheels are 18-inch size with 200 mm ground clearance.
Chery-Tiggo-8.name: First Generation

Chery-Tiggo-8.description: Introduced in October 2020, the Tiggo 8 Plus is a more upmarket version of the first generation Tiggo 8 for the Chinese domestic market, marketed as Tiggo 8 Pro or Tiggo 8 Pro Max in overseas markets. The Plus variant features redesigned front and rear ends with the 'Life In Motion 3.0' design language, measuring 22 mm longer and 1 mm higher than the regular Tiggo 8. It is available in 5-, 6-, and 7-seater configurations with 18-inch and 19-inch redesigned alloy wheels. The interior features dual 12.3-inch displays with the LION 4.0 infotainment system and 8-speaker Sony stereo systems. Engine options include a 1.6L turbocharged engine with 145 kW (197 HP) mated to a 7-speed dual-clutch transmission, a mild hybrid 1.5L turbocharged engine (48V) with 156 HP paired with a CVT, and a 2.0L turbocharged engine (390T Kunpeng variant) with 187 kW (254 HP) and 390 Nm of torque. This variant represents significant visual and technical updates to the first-generation platform.
Chery-Tiggo-8.name: First Generation (Tiggo 8 Plus Facelift)

Chery-Tiggo-8.description: In April 2024, Chery introduced the all-new second generation Tiggo 8 (marketed as Tiggo 8 Plus II in China and as Tiggo 8 Pro in some overseas markets). This generation received a complete redesign with restyled front and rear fascia, new door panels with flush door handles, and a fully redesigned interior. The second generation retains the same T1X platform but with the new model code T18FL4. It is available in various configurations including the Fulwin T8 (launched in February 2025), which is the C-DM plug-in hybrid variant sold under the Fulwin NEV product series. Engine options include 1.6L and 2.0L turbocharged petrol engines, as well as Kunpeng plug-in hybrid powertrains. The Fulwin T8 hybrid variant is powered by a 1.5L engine with 115 kW (154 HP) combined with an electric motor and equipped with an 18.46 kWh or 18.66 kWh lithium iron phosphate battery, offering a pure electric range of 90 km. Additional features include 7-speed dual-clutch and 8-speed CVT transmissions, with assembly locations in China (Wuhu, Anhui) and Russia (Kaluga).
Chery-Tiggo-8.name: Second Generation

Chevrolet-Aveo.description: The original Chevrolet Aveo was based on the T200 platform, introduced in September 2002 as the Daewoo Kalos. It was available in both sedan and five-door hatchback body styles. Designed by Italdesign Giugiaro, it featured conservative styling with a focus on practicality and affordability. Engine options ranged from 1.2L to 1.6L producing between 70-110 HP. The T200 was sold in three and four available body styles: a 4-door sedan and 5-door hatchback from the beginning of production in 2002, and a 3-door hatchback available in certain European markets beginning in 2005.
Chevrolet-Aveo.name: First Generation (T200)

Chevrolet-Aveo.description: GM introduced the heavily facelifted sedan at the 2005 Auto Shanghai, bearing the internal code T250 and marketed in South Korea as the Daewoo Gentra. Revisions included exterior styling changes, a new interior instrument panel, and minor equipment changes including increased sound deadening. A facelifted hatchback with the sedan's updated instrument panel was presented as the Chevrolet Aveo at the 2007 Frankfurt Motor Show for global marketing. The Korean market received its own distinct restyle of the hatchback, the Gentra X. Engine updates included a 1.2L S-TEC II engine with dual overhead camshaft (DOHC) and timing chain system, and a 1.6L GEN-III Ecotec Family 1 engine with variable valve timing.
Chevrolet-Aveo.name: First Generation (T250 Facelift)

Chevrolet-Aveo.description: The second-generation Aveo debuted at the 2010 Paris Motor Show, using the GM Gamma II global subcompact platform. It was marketed as the Chevrolet Sonic in the Americas, Japan, Middle East, South Africa, and several Southeast Asian markets, and as Holden Barina in Australia and New Zealand. The exterior featured more dynamic styling with motorcycle-inspired headlights and a more contemporary overall design. North American models featured a 1.8-liter engine producing 135 hp and 125 lb-ft torque, or a 1.4-liter turbo engine producing 138 hp and 148 lb-ft torque. On August 2, 2011, the Sonic entered production at Orion Assembly in Michigan.
Chevrolet-Aveo.name: Second Generation (T300)

Chevrolet-Aveo.description: At the 2016 New York International Auto Show, Chevrolet revealed the refreshed North American version of the Sonic hatchback and sedan. The facelift brought a restyled front fascia, new LED tail lights, and refreshed equipment. The LTZ trim level was renamed Premier for the 2017 model year. The RS trim level became a standard appearance package for all Hatchback models, featuring unique upholstery, red interior accents and stitching, unique RS badging, and unique aluminum-alloy wheels. Production of the second-generation model ended in October 2020, with the Sonic discontinued in North America due to GM's plans to convert Orion Assembly to EV production.
Chevrolet-Aveo.name: Second Generation (T300 Facelift)
