Special models included the sporty RS package with unique styling elements and the performance-oriented RS Turbo with sport-tuned suspension. Despite receiving generally positive reviews for its driving dynamics, practicality, and feature content, declining sales of small cars led to its discontinuation after the 2020 model year as GM shifted focus to crossovers and SUVs. The Sonic represented Chevrolet's most competitive small car offering in North America up to that point, helping to improve the brand's reputation in the segment.
Chevrolet-Sonic.name: First Generation

Chevrolet-Spark.description: The first-generation Chevrolet Spark sold globally (known as the Daewoo Matiz in some markets) was a city-focused minicar featuring a tall, narrow body design that maximized interior space despite its tiny footprint. In North America, it arrived for the 2013 model year powered by a 1.2L four-cylinder engine producing just 84 HP, paired with either a five-speed manual or four-speed automatic transmission. Despite its modest power, the lightweight design provided adequate urban performance with excellent fuel economy. The interior was surprisingly spacious for its size class and featured motorcycle-inspired gauges and available technology including a touchscreen infotainment system. Bold color options and quirky styling helped distinguish it in the minicar segment. The Spark represented Chevrolet's entry into the smallest vehicle segment in North America, targeting urban dwellers seeking easy parking and maneuverability.
Chevrolet-Spark.name: First Generation (M300)

Chevrolet-Spark.description: The second-generation Spark featured more mature styling with less exaggerated proportions while maintaining the small footprint that defined the model. The overall height was reduced by about 1.6 inches while the width increased slightly, giving it a more grounded appearance. Power came from a 1.4L four-cylinder engine producing 98 HP, paired with a five-speed manual or continuously variable transmission (CVT). The interior featured improved materials and significantly updated technology, including a standard 7-inch touchscreen with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility on most trims. Advanced safety features became available, including forward collision alert and lane departure warning—unusual for the minicar segment. A brief all-electric Spark EV variant was offered in limited markets from 2013-2016, featuring a 130 HP electric motor and approximately 82 miles of range. The second-generation Spark maintained its position as the smallest Chevrolet while offering surprising technology and safety features for its class. Production ended in 2022 without a direct replacement, as consumer preferences shifted toward larger vehicles and GM reduced its small car offerings in North America.
Chevrolet-Spark.name: Second Generation

Chevrolet-Tahoe.description: The original Chevrolet Tahoe replaced the full-size Blazer nameplate, available as a two-door or four-door full-size SUV. Built on GM's GMT400 truck platform shared with the Silverado, it featured body-on-frame construction with V8 power (5.7L standard) and four-wheel drive capability. The interior offered two or three rows of seating with relatively basic amenities by modern standards. This generation established the Tahoe as a more family-friendly alternative to the larger Suburban while maintaining significant towing and off-road capability.
Chevrolet-Tahoe.name: First Generation (GMT400)

Chevrolet-Tahoe.description: The redesigned Tahoe featured more rounded styling, improved structural rigidity, and enhanced powertrains. The two-door variant was discontinued, leaving only the more popular four-door model. Engine options included 4.8L and 5.3L V8s, with later models receiving cylinder deactivation technology for improved fuel economy. The interior saw significant improvements in design, comfort, and technology. Safety features expanded to include standard four-wheel disc brakes and available side-impact airbags. Special models included the Z71 off-road package and the more luxurious LTZ trim level. This generation solidified the Tahoe's position as a popular choice for families requiring towing capability and three-row seating.
Chevrolet-Tahoe.name: Second Generation (GMT800)

Chevrolet-Tahoe.description: The third-generation Tahoe featured more aerodynamic styling, an improved structure with higher torsional rigidity, and updated powertrains focused on balancing power with efficiency. The primary engine was a 5.3L V8 with cylinder deactivation technology, paired with a six-speed automatic transmission in later models. A short-lived Hybrid variant featured a two-mode hybrid system paired with a 6.0L V8, achieving improved city fuel economy. The interior offered significantly enhanced materials, design, and technology features. Safety advanced with standard stability control, side curtain airbags, and available features like blind spot monitoring. This generation maintained the Tahoe's core attributes of rugged capability and family-friendly versatility while improving refinement and efficiency.
Chevrolet-Tahoe.name: Third Generation (GMT900)

Chevrolet-Tahoe.description: The fourth-generation Tahoe featured more truck-like styling with squared-off lines and a prominent front fascia. Built on GM's K2XX platform, it maintained body-on-frame construction but added significant technology improvements, including magnetic ride control on higher trims. Powered by a 5.3L V8 as standard with an optional 6.2L V8 on premium models, both featuring direct injection and cylinder deactivation for improved efficiency. The interior offered enhanced materials, design, and a comprehensive infotainment system with available rear-seat entertainment. A significant evolution was the adoption of a fold-flat third row, enabled by a new independent rear suspension on some variants, greatly improving cargo flexibility. This generation enhanced the Tahoe's premium positioning while maintaining its traditional capability.
Chevrolet-Tahoe.name: Fourth Generation (K2XX)

Chevrolet-Tahoe.description: The current Tahoe represents the most significant redesign in the model's history, adopting an independent rear suspension across all models that dramatically improves interior space and ride quality. Exterior dimensions increased, resulting in substantially more third-row legroom and cargo capacity. Powertrain options expanded to include a 5.3L V8, 6.2L V8, and for the first time, a 3.0L Duramax diesel inline-six, all paired with a 10-speed automatic transmission. The interior features a complete redesign with available features including a 10.2-inch touchscreen, digital instrument cluster, and up to nine camera views for trailering and off-road use. New variants include the off-road focused Z71 with standard four-wheel drive and skid plates, and the street-performance RST. Available technology includes adaptive air suspension, magnetic ride control, and a power-sliding center console. The fifth-generation Tahoe maintains its body-on-frame construction and significant capability while offering unprecedented levels of comfort, refinement, and technology.
Chevrolet-Tahoe.name: Fifth Generation (T1XX)

Chevrolet-Trailblazer.description: The original Chevrolet TrailBlazer is a mid-size SUV built on GM's GMT360 platform with body-on-frame construction. Standard power came from a 4.2L inline-six engine producing 275 HP, with optional 5.3L and 6.0L V8 engines available. The TrailBlazer offered significant off-road capability and towing capacity, competing with the Ford Explorer and Jeep Grand Cherokee. It was available in standard and extended-length EXT models with three rows of seating. Trim levels included LS, LT, and LTZ. The SS performance variant was not introduced until 2006.
Chevrolet-Trailblazer.name: First Generation (KC; 2002-2005)

Chevrolet-Trailblazer.description: The 2006 model year brought a significant refresh with updated front fascias, new interior trim, and the introduction of the high-performance SS variant featuring a 6.0L LS2 V8 producing 395 HP. Side-curtain airbags became standard in 2008. The platform remained GMT360, but cosmetic updates and the new SS performance trim represent a significant visual and performance evolution. The TrailBlazer EXT production ended in 2006.
Chevrolet-Trailblazer.name: First Generation (KC; 2006-2009) - Facelifted

Chevrolet-Trailblazer.description: A newly redesigned TrailBlazer was introduced for the Asian and Brazilian markets, based on a truck frame (platform GMT31XX) related to the second-generation Chevrolet Colorado. This version maintained body-on-frame construction with three rows of seating and was positioned as a rugged SUV for markets prioritizing off-road performance. Engine options included a 3.6L V6 gasoline engine and 2.5L/2.8L turbocharged diesel engines. It was sold in Thailand (2012-2020), Brazil (2011-present at time of Wikipedia content), India, South Africa, and the Middle East. Marketed as the Holden Colorado 7 in Australia from 2012-2016, then as Holden Trailblazer from 2016-2020. Multiple facelifts occurred during this period.
Chevrolet-Trailblazer.name: Second Generation (RG; 2012-2020) - International Markets

Chevrolet-Trailblazer.description: A complete reimagining of the TrailBlazer nameplate as a subcompact crossover SUV built on GM's VSS-F platform with unibody construction. Significantly smaller than predecessors, it features front-wheel drive architecture with available all-wheel drive. Powertrain options include a 1.2L turbocharged three-cylinder producing 102 kW (137 HP) or a 1.3L turbocharged three-cylinder producing 115.5 kW (155 HP), paired with CVT (FWD) or nine-speed automatic (AWD). Available trim levels: L, LS, LT, ACTIV, and RS. Design features bold styling with available two-tone roof options. The interior includes a 7-inch or optional 8-inch touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. Manufactured in South Korea and China.
Chevrolet-Trailblazer.name: Third Generation (9BXX; 2021-2023)

Chevrolet-Trailblazer.description: The Trailblazer received a facelift in February 2024 for the 2024 model year. Changes include a new front fascia with curvier design, new front bumper, new running lights, new LED taillights, new exterior colors, and new wheel designs. The interior received a larger 11-inch touchscreen infotainment system with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto and an 8.8-inch digital instrument cluster. Powertrain options remain 1.2L and 1.3L turbocharged three-cylinder engines. The platform (VSS-F) and overall design remain essentially unchanged from the 2021-2023 generation.
Chevrolet-Trailblazer.name: Third Generation (9BXX; 2024+) - Facelifted

Chevrolet-Traverse.description: The original Chevrolet Traverse was a full-size crossover SUV built on GM's Lambda platform (GMT561) shared with the Buick Enclave, GMC Acadia, and Saturn Outlook. Introduced at the 2008 Chicago Auto Show, production began in Spring Hill, Tennessee in 2008 and moved to Delta Township, Michigan in 2010. It replaced the Uplander minivan and TrailBlazer SUV, featuring unibody construction for better ride quality and interior space utilization than traditional body-on-frame SUVs. Powered by a 3.6L LLT V6 engine producing between 281-288 HP depending on the model year, paired with a six-speed automatic transmission. Available in front-wheel or all-wheel drive configurations, it offered seating for up to eight passengers with class-leading cargo space. The interior focused on family-friendly features including available rear-seat entertainment, multiple USB ports, and flexible seating configurations. This generation established the Traverse as Chevrolet's largest crossover, offering minivan-like space with SUV styling.
Chevrolet-Traverse.name: First Generation

Chevrolet-Traverse.description: A facelift of the Chevrolet Traverse was unveiled at the 2012 New York International Auto Show. The 2013 Traverse received a new grille and front fascia, a redesigned rear liftgate, and reworked Camaro-inspired tail lights. The transmission was reworked for improved shift quality and timing. Chevrolet's new color touchscreen and MyLink radios were standard, as well as wood interior trim. Cloth and leather seating surfaces were available with different standard configurations by trim level. The 2014 model year added Forward Collision Alert and Lane Departure Warning. The 2015 model year introduced a revised 18-inch wheel and Siri Eyes Free. For 2016, the Traverse included OnStar 4G LTE connectivity with Wi-Fi hotspot. For 2017, the LTZ trim was renamed to Premier. Throughout this facelift period, the Lambda platform remained unchanged, maintaining the same unibody construction and 3.6L V6 powertrain architecture.
Chevrolet-Traverse.name: First Generation (2013 Facelift)

Chevrolet-Traverse.description: Unveiled at the 2017 North American International Auto Show on January 23, 2017, the second generation Traverse was introduced for the 2018 model year and went on sale in July 2017. Built on GM's C1XX platform, it featured more truck-inspired styling with a larger, more upright appearance while maintaining unibody construction with a longer wheelbase for improved interior space. Powered by a 3.6L V6 engine producing 310 HP paired with a nine-speed automatic transmission. The interior saw significant upgrades in material quality, design, and technology, featuring an available 8-inch touchscreen with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility. Seating for seven or eight passengers remained available, with enhanced comfort in all three rows and improved cargo capacity. Safety technology expanded to include available automatic emergency braking, lane keep assist, and adaptive cruise control. Special trim levels included RS and High Country options.
Chevrolet-Traverse.name: Second Generation

Chevrolet-Traverse.description: Originally planned for the 2021 model year, Chevrolet gave the Traverse a refreshed look for 2022, adopting a grille similar to the redesigned Suburban/Tahoe vehicles and featuring thin LED headlights and tail lights, plus new daytime running lights with integrated LED turn signals. The facelift introduced new interior seating options, wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, and a new available eight-inch infotainment display. Several safety features became standard: Automatic Emergency Braking, Front Pedestrian Braking, Forward Collision Alert, Lane Keep Assist with Lane Departure Warning, IntelliBeam auto high beams, and a Following Distance Indicator. Advanced Adaptive Cruise Control was added to select trims, and GM's Safety Alert Seat became standard on Premier and High Country models. The 2023 model year was originally anticipated to be the last for the second generation, but due to delays in third generation production, a 2024 model year was produced for the second generation, called the Chevrolet Traverse Limited, allowing continued availability while third generation ramped up production.
Chevrolet-Traverse.name: Second Generation (2022 Facelift)

Chevrolet-Traverse.description: Unveiled on July 17, 2023, the third generation Traverse was introduced for the 2024 model year with first customer deliveries commencing in April 2024. Built on GM's new VSS-S platform (C1XX-2), it features a complete redesign with a more rugged, SUV-like appearance inspired by the truck-based Tahoe. The exterior balances crossover and truck design elements with a truck-inspired front fascia and split headlights, with standard LED front and rear lighting. Powered by a new 2.5L turbocharged four-cylinder engine producing 328 HP and 326 lb-ft of torque, replacing the previous V6 while offering more torque and improved efficiency. Paired with an 8-speed automatic transmission and available in FWD or AWD configurations. The interior features a lower-mounted 11-inch instrument cluster and a 17.7-inch color touchscreen (two times larger than the largest screen in the previous generation). Seating configurations offer both eight-passenger (with bench seats) and seven-passenger (with captain seats) layouts, with maximum cargo space of 98 cubic feet. The Z71 trim features 1-inch increased ground clearance, all-terrain tires, unique styling, a standard trailering package, and terrain-specific drive modes. All models come standard with Chevy Safety Assist and optional Super Cruise hands-free driving capability.
Chevrolet-Traverse.name: Third Generation

Chevrolet-Trax.description: The original Chevrolet Trax was a subcompact crossover SUV built on GM's Gamma II platform shared with the Buick Encore. Introduced in global markets in 2013 and arriving in the U.S. for the 2015 model year, it featured a tall, boxy design that maximized interior space within a small footprint. Powered by a 1.4L turbocharged four-cylinder engine producing 138 HP, paired with a six-speed automatic transmission. Available in front-wheel or all-wheel drive configurations, it focused on urban usability with city-friendly dimensions and good fuel economy. The interior offered a relatively high seating position and surprising space for its class, with a 7-inch touchscreen infotainment system added in later models. Model code U200 built on the same platform as the Buick Encore. Despite its modest performance, the first-generation Trax found success as an affordable entry point to Chevrolet's SUV lineup, appealing to first-time buyers and urban dwellers seeking versatility in a compact package.
Chevrolet-Trax.name: First Generation

Chevrolet-Trax.description: Chevrolet performed a mid-cycle update on the Trax for the 2017 model year, first unveiled at the 2016 Chicago Auto Show on February 12, 2016, going on sale in fall 2016. The facelift introduced a dramatic styling refresh with design cues from the Malibu and Volt, including new halogen projector headlights, LED daytime running lights, dual taillights, and a new grille design. The interior was comprehensively redesigned with a new dashboard and center instrument panel that improved perceived quality. Still built on the GM Gamma II platform with the same 1.4L turbocharged four-cylinder engine and six-speed automatic transmission, the facelift maintained the same platform while delivering significant visual and technological improvements. The 2017 refresh model continued unchanged through 2022, when it was replaced by the larger second-generation Trax.
Chevrolet-Trax.name: First Generation (2017 Facelift)

Chevrolet-Trax.description: The completely redesigned second-generation Trax features a dramatic styling transformation with a longer, wider, and lower profile compared to its predecessor. No longer a tall, boxy subcompact SUV, the new Trax adopts sleeker proportions inspired by the larger Blazer, with a coupe-like roofline and more aggressive design elements. Built on GM's VSS-F platform (9CXX), it is classified as a compact rather than subcompact, with significantly increased dimensions providing more passenger and cargo space. Powered by a 1.2L turbocharged three-cylinder engine producing 137 HP, paired with a six-speed automatic transmission, it is available exclusively with front-wheel drive. The interior represents a major advancement with a standard 8-inch (LT and higher trims: 11-inch) touchscreen infotainment system and an 8-inch digital instrument cluster on higher trims. Standard features include wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, with available technology including adaptive cruise control, wireless phone charging, and a sunroof. First introduced in China in July 2022 as the Chevrolet Seeker, the North American version was unveiled in October 2022 with sales beginning in Q2 2023 as a 2024 model. Despite growing in size, the second-generation Trax maintains a value-oriented approach with a starting price lower than many competitors, positioned as an affordable yet stylish and technology-rich alternative to both small SUVs and traditional compact sedans.
Chevrolet-Trax.name: Second Generation

Chevrolet-Volt.description: The original Chevrolet Volt was a groundbreaking plug-in hybrid electric vehicle (PHEV) that GM called an 'extended-range electric vehicle' to emphasize its electric-first operation. Featuring a T-shaped 16 kWh lithium-ion battery pack and a complex propulsion system combining a 1.4L gasoline engine with electric motors, it offered approximately 35-40 miles of electric-only range before the gasoline engine engaged to extend total range to about 380 miles. The exterior featured aerodynamic styling to maximize efficiency, while the interior offered a futuristic design with a center-mounted digital display and touch-sensitive controls. Seating was limited to four passengers due to the battery placement. Built on the Delta II platform shared with the Chevrolet Cruze, the first-generation Volt was unveiled in September 2008 and began retail deliveries in December 2010. As one of the first mainstream plug-in hybrids on the market, the Volt won numerous awards including North American Car of the Year and represented GM's commitment to electrification technology. A minor update in 2013 increased electric range slightly and added new features.
Chevrolet-Volt.name: First Generation

Chevrolet-Volt.description: The redesigned Volt featured more conventional exterior styling while maintaining good aerodynamics, addressing feedback that the original model looked too unusual. The propulsion system was thoroughly updated with a new 18.4 kWh lithium-ion battery and more efficient 1.5L range-extending engine, increasing electric range to approximately 53 miles and total range to over 400 miles. Energy efficiency improved with the new system requiring less gasoline when operating in extended-range mode. The interior adopted a more mainstream design with improved materials, conventional instruments, and seating for five passengers (though the middle rear position was compromised by the battery tunnel). Technology advanced with a standard 8-inch touchscreen featuring Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility, and available driver assistance features including adaptive cruise control and automatic emergency braking. Unveiled in January 2015, the second generation began retail deliveries in October 2015 as a 2016 model year. Despite being well-received and technologically advanced, declining sales amid shifting market preferences toward SUVs led to the Volt's discontinuation after the 2019 model year as GM redirected resources toward fully electric vehicles, with production ending in February 2019. The Volt's legacy includes pioneering PHEV technology that influenced subsequent electrified vehicles and advancing battery management systems that would benefit GM's later EV efforts.
Chevrolet-Volt.name: Second Generation

Chrysler-200.description: The original Chrysler 200 was essentially a heavily refreshed version of the Chrysler Sebring, representing Chrysler's attempt to improve its competitiveness in the mid-size segment following the company's restructuring under Fiat. Available as both a sedan and convertible (with soft or retractable hardtop), it featured significantly updated exterior styling with a more modern appearance. The interior saw major improvements in design and material quality compared to the Sebring. Powertrain options included a 2.4L four-cylinder or a 3.6L Pentastar V6 producing 283 HP, the latter providing class-competitive performance. The first-generation 200 was featured in Chrysler's notable 'Imported from Detroit' advertising campaign and represented a transitional model aimed at improving the brand's image while a completely new generation was developed.
Chrysler-200.name: First Generation

Chrysler-200.description: The completely redesigned second-generation 200 represented a significant leap forward in design, technology, and refinement. Available only as a sedan (the convertible was discontinued), it featured sleek, coupe-like styling with a sloping roofline and distinctive front fascia. Built on an extended version of the Fiat Compact platform, it offered front-wheel drive as standard with an innovative available all-wheel drive system that could disconnect the rear axle when not needed for improved efficiency. Powertrain options continued with a 2.4L four-cylinder or 3.6L V6, the latter now paired with a segment-first nine-speed automatic transmission. The interior featured premium materials, especially in higher trims, and advanced technology including an 8.4-inch Uconnect touchscreen system and electronic rotary gear selector. Despite critical acclaim for its design and features, the 200 faced challenges including limited rear seat headroom due to its stylish roofline and some issues with the nine-speed transmission's refinement in early models. Declining sedan sales industry-wide and FCA's strategic decision to focus on Jeep SUVs and Ram trucks led to the model's discontinuation after just three years, making it one of the shortest-lived generations in its class. The second-generation 200 represented Chrysler's most competitive mid-size sedan offering but fell victim to changing market preferences and corporate strategy.
Chrysler-200.name: Second Generation

Chrysler-300.description: The modern Chrysler 300 revived a storied nameplate with bold, distinctive styling featuring a high beltline, imposing grille, and chopped-roof appearance inspired by 1950s American luxury cars. Built on the rear-wheel drive LX platform with significant Mercedes-Benz components (stemming from the DaimlerChrysler era), it offered an authentic American luxury sedan experience. Engine options ranged from a 2.7L V6 to a 5.7L HEMI V8 in the 300C model, with the high-performance SRT-8 variant featuring a 6.1L HEMI producing 425 HP. The spacious interior combined American luxury traditions with modern technology, though material quality was inconsistent. The first-generation 300 was a significant success for Chrysler, appealing to both traditional domestic luxury buyers and a younger demographic attracted to its distinctive style and available performance.
Chrysler-300.name: First Generation

Chrysler-300.description: The second-generation 300, based on the evolved LD platform (descended from the LX platform), was introduced in late 2010 for the 2011 model year. Exterior changes included revised sheet metal, thinner roof pillars, a more raked windshield, bi-xenon HID projector headlights with LED daytime running strips, new LED taillights, and a horizontally slotted front grille. Engine options included a 3.6L Pentastar V6 and 5.7L HEMI V8, with the SRT variant featuring a 6.4L HEMI. The interior saw improvements in design, material quality, and technology with the Uconnect infotainment system. Transmission options included 5-speed Mercedes-Benz automatic or 8-speed automatic. Available all-wheel drive and panoramic sunroof offered additional refinement for this American luxury sedan.
Chrysler-300.name: Second Generation (2011-2014)

Chrysler-300.description: In late 2014, a comprehensive facelift version of the 300 was introduced for the 2015 model year. Significant visual and technological enhancements included restyled front and rear fascias, a new black and silver mesh chrome grille, a new 3-spoke steering wheel design, and new exterior styling cues. Technology upgrades featured full-speed range Adaptive Cruise Control with Stop, Forward Collision Warning with Active Braking, Lane Departure Warning with Lane Keep Assist, and a 7-inch electronic instrument cluster. The Uconnect infotainment system was updated with Bluetooth and Voice Command. All models now featured the 8-speed TorqueFlite automatic transmission. Engine options remained the 3.6L Pentastar V6 and 5.7L HEMI V8. This extended final generation continued until production ended in December 2023, maintaining the Chrysler 300's position as one of the few remaining traditional American rear-wheel drive luxury sedans offering V8 power and distinctive styling.
Chrysler-300.name: Second Generation (2015-2023 Facelift)

Chrysler-Pacifica.description: A mid-size luxury crossover that combined minivan versatility with SUV styling and car-like handling. Built on a modified minivan platform (Chrysler CS platform), the Pacifica featured distinctive design elements including a sloping hood, prominent grille, and 5-door SUV body style. Production began in January 2003 with the final unit rolling off the assembly line on November 23, 2007. Available in front-wheel drive or all-wheel drive configurations with seating for up to six passengers across three rows. Powered by gasoline engines including a 3.5L V6 (250 hp), 3.8L V6 (210-200 hp), and later 4.0L V6 (255 hp) with various automatic transmissions. The Pacifica featured premium materials, innovative storage solutions, and equipped with advanced technology for its time including optional navigation systems and DVD entertainment. Despite being touted as a pioneer in the crossover segment, sales underperformed expectations due to competition from established luxury crossovers, pricing perceived as high for the Chrysler marque, and comparison with the less expensive Town & Country minivan. The model was discontinued in 2007-2008 without a direct successor until the nameplate was revived for the minivan in 2017.
Chrysler-Pacifica.name: First Generation (Crossover)

Chrysler-Pacifica.description: A minivan that replaced the Chrysler Town & Country, reviving the Pacifica nameplate for 2017 model year. Production began in 2016 at the Windsor Assembly Plant in Ontario, Canada. Built on an all-new Compact Wide platform (different from the original crossover), the modern Pacifica features sleek, crossover-inspired styling to disassociate it from traditional boxy minivans. Powered by a 3.6L Pentastar V6 engine producing 287 hp, paired with a 9-speed automatic transmission (948TE). The Pacifica marked the introduction of the first plug-in hybrid (PHEV) minivan in the United States market, available alongside conventional gasoline models, with the hybrid featuring 33 miles of electric-only range. Features include Stow 'n Go seating that folds flat into the floor, Uconnect infotainment systems, panoramic sunroof, hands-free sliding doors, and comprehensive driver assistance technology. An all-wheel drive option was introduced for 2020 model year. The entry-level Voyager nameplate was reintroduced in 2020 for lower-trim versions. The Pacifica earned numerous awards including IIHS Top Safety Pick+ and recognition as best family vehicle from multiple publications.
Chrysler-Pacifica.name: Second Generation (Minivan)

Chrysler-Pacifica.description: A restyled 2021 Chrysler Pacifica introduced at the 2020 Chicago Auto Show with comprehensive updates. The facelift featured new exterior styling with updated headlights, grille, and body panels. Interior updates included the new Uconnect 5 infotainment system with 10.1-inch high-resolution touchscreen display, wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone integration, Amazon Alexa capabilities, and USB-C charging ports. The Pinnacle luxury trim was introduced with quilted leather seating and unique exterior badging. All-wheel-drive option became available for gasoline-powered models (hybrid models remained front-wheel-drive only). The FamCam rear camera system allows displaying rear passenger images in place of a conversation mirror. The 2021+ Pacifica continues production at Windsor Assembly Plant in Ontario, Canada, and remains Chrysler's flagship vehicle. The Voyager nameplate (2020-2021 retail models, 2022+ fleet-only, 2025+ returned to retail) and Chrysler Grand Caravan nameplate (Canada, 2021+) serve as less expensive variants of the same platform.
Chrysler-Pacifica.name: Second Generation (Minivan) - 2021 Facelift

Chrysler-Pacifica-Hybrid.description: The Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid (technically a plug-in hybrid despite the simplified naming) was the first electrified minivan in the American market. Based on the standard Pacifica, it combines a modified version of the 3.6L Pentastar V6 engine with a dual-motor eFlite electrically variable transmission and a 16 kWh lithium-ion battery pack mounted under the floor. This system delivers a combined 260 HP and an all-electric range of approximately 32-33 miles before the gasoline engine engages, with a total range of over 500 miles. The battery can be fully charged in approximately 2 hours using a 240-volt Level 2 charger or about 14 hours with a standard household outlet. Unlike the regular Pacifica, the Hybrid model doesn't offer Stow 'n Go second-row seats (as the battery occupies that underfloor space), though it maintains the fold-flat third row. Interior appointments and available technology closely match the conventional Pacifica, including the Uconnect Theater rear entertainment system and advanced safety features. The Pacifica Hybrid qualifies for federal tax incentives and various state rebates, making it an attractive option for environmentally conscious families seeking minivan practicality with significantly improved fuel efficiency.
Chrysler-Pacifica-Hybrid.name: First Generation

Chrysler-Pacifica-Hybrid.description: A restyled 2021 Chrysler Pacifica marked a significant refresh of the plug-in hybrid variant. The facelift introduced new exterior styling, new Uconnect 5 infotainment system with a standard 10.1-inch high-resolution touchscreen display, wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone integration, Amazon Alexa capabilities, and SiriusXM Satellite Radio with high-speed data connectivity. USB-C high-speed data and charging ports became standard. The FamCam rear camera system displays an image of rear passengers. A new Pinnacle trim level was introduced with unique leather seat trim and quilted leather pillows for second-row seats. The Pacifica Hybrid remains front-wheel drive only (unlike the gasoline model which gained AWD in 2020), with the 16 kWh lithium-ion battery pack and 33-mile electric range continuing. EPA-estimated fuel economy of 82-84 MPGe in combined electric/gasoline operation represents exceptional efficiency for a seven-passenger vehicle.
Chrysler-Pacifica-Hybrid.name: First Generation (2021 Facelift)

Chrysler-Sebring.description: The Chrysler Sebring coupe was introduced in April 1995, succeeding the Chrysler LeBaron coupe. It was based on the Mitsubishi Eclipse platform (Chrysler FJ platform) and manufactured at the Mitsubishi plant in Normal, Illinois. The coupe featured four-cylinder and V6 engine options, including a 2.0L 420A I4 and 2.5L 6G73 Mitsubishi V6. The 1997 model year received a minor facelift with a new larger black grille, ribbed lower body cladding, and new wheel styles. This generation set the foundation for the Sebring nameplate with distinctive styling and competitive pricing.
Chrysler-Sebring.name: First Generation (Coupe)

Chrysler-Sebring.description: The Chrysler Sebring convertible was launched in 1996, replacing the LeBaron convertible. Unlike the coupe, it was based on the Chrysler JA/JX platform also used for the Chrysler Cirrus sedan and was assembled in Mexico. The convertible featured 2.4L EDZ and turocharged 2.4L EDV/EDT four-cylinder engines, or a 2.5L Mitsubishi 6G73 V6. The convertible was marketed in Europe and Mexico as the Chrysler Stratus. This model offered an affordable four-seat convertible with a focus on style and value.
Chrysler-Sebring.name: First Generation (Convertible)

Chrysler-Sebring.description: Presented at the 2000 New York Auto Show, the second-generation Sebring sedan and convertible shared the Chrysler JR platform and were assembled in Sterling Heights, Michigan. The sedan and convertible featured 2.4L EDZ four-cylinder engines and a 2.7L EER V6 with E85 capability. The 2004 sedan received minor tweaks including a redesigned grille, reworked headlights, and Chrysler winged emblem. In Mexico, the Sebring was marketed as the Chrysler Cirrus with availability of a turbocharged 2.4L DOHC engine unique to that market. Both body styles maintained strong sales in the convertible segment.
Chrysler-Sebring.name: Second Generation (Sedan and Convertible)

Chrysler-Sebring.description: The second-generation Sebring coupe was styled by Chrysler and engineered by Mitsubishi Motors North America at their Normal, Illinois facility. It was based on the Mitsubishi Eclipse's Chrysler ST-22 platform with a three-inch wheelbase extension. The coupe featured 2.4L Mitsubishi 4G64 four-cylinder (147 hp) and 3.0L Mitsubishi 6G72 V6 (200 hp) engines. The coupe received a minor facelift for 2003. It was discontinued after the 2005 model year.
Chrysler-Sebring.name: Second Generation (Coupe)

Chrysler-Sebring.description: The third-generation Sebring sedan was introduced for 2007, built on the Chrysler JS platform and assembled in Sterling Heights, Michigan. It featured a complete redesign with a distinctive front fascia and ribbed hood strakes. Engine options included a 2.4L GEMA World I4, 2.7L EER V6 capable of E85, and 3.5L EGF SOHC V6. The 3.5L V6 model was available with all-wheel drive for 2008 only. In 2009, rear badge placements were modified. For 2010, the hood was redesigned eliminating longitudinal grooves, and the Sebring received IIHS Top Safety Pick awards for its crash performance. The sedan was replaced by the rebadged Chrysler 200 for the 2011 model year.
Chrysler-Sebring.name: Third Generation (Sedan)

Chrysler-Sebring.description: The third-generation Sebring convertible debuted at the 2007 Los Angeles International Auto Show as an early 2008 model. Unlike the 2007 sedan-only year, the convertible featured hood strakes recalling the Chrysler Crossfire design. It offered both retractable hardtop and soft top options manufactured by Karmann. The LX model included a 2.4L I4, Touring came with a 2.7L V6, and Limited featured a 3.5L V6. It was the second bestselling four-place open-top car in the United States, trailing only the Ford Mustang convertible. The convertible was replaced by the Chrysler 200 convertible for the 2011 model year.
Chrysler-Sebring.name: Third Generation (Convertible)

Citroen-Basalt.description: The Citroën Basalt (model code CC26) is a subcompact crossover SUV developed for emerging markets such as India and Brazil. Built on the Smart Car Platform (CMP - Common Modular Platform), it is related to the Citroën C3 (CC21) and Citroën C3 Aircross (CC24). The vehicle features a distinctive 5-door coupe SUV body style with a sloping roofline creating a fastback-like silhouette between a traditional sedan and an SUV. The exterior design incorporates Citroën's signature two-tier lighting arrangement and double-chevron logo integrated into the grille. The interior offers a modern design with a floating touchscreen infotainment system, digital instrument options, and practical storage solutions. Powertrain options include 1.0L naturally aspirated FireFly three-cylinder, 1.0L turbocharged FireFly three-cylinder (both flex-fuel for Brazil market), and 1.2L turbocharged EB2DT three-cylinder engines, paired with 5-speed manual, 6-speed manual, or 6-speed automatic transmissions depending on market. Production commenced in 2024 with launches in India (August 30, 2024), Brazil (October 2, 2024), and Indonesia (July 24, 2025). The vehicle is assembled in India (Tiruvallur) and Brazil (Porto Real) by Stellantis operations.
Citroen-Basalt.name: First Generation

Citroen-Berlingo.description: The original Citroën Berlingo pioneered the leisure activity vehicle (LAV) segment in Europe, combining van-like practicality with car-like comfort. Available in commercial van (Berlingo Van) and passenger (Berlingo Multispace) variants, it featured a boxy, utilitarian design with sliding rear doors for easy access. Based on a modified Citroën ZX/Peugeot 306 platform, it offered front-wheel drive with various gasoline and diesel engine options, typically ranging from 1.4L to 2.0L. The interior was basic but functional, focusing on space efficiency rather than luxury. Later updates added improved safety features and equipment. This generation's innovative approach to practical, affordable family transportation influenced numerous competitors and established the Berlingo as a core model in Citroën's lineup.
Citroen-Berlingo.name: First Generation

Citroen-Berlingo.description: The second-generation Berlingo maintained the practical approach of its predecessor but with more modern styling, improved refinement, and enhanced safety. Available in standard (L1) and extended (L2) lengths, it continued to offer both commercial and passenger variants. Built on PSA's Platform 2, it shared its underpinnings with the Peugeot Partner and featured a range of petrol and diesel engines, with the latter being particularly popular for their efficiency. The interior saw significant improvements in material quality and technology, including available features like a touchscreen infotainment system in later models. Safety advanced with standard stability control and available features like a reversing camera. This generation successfully balanced its utilitarian origins with more car-like attributes to appeal to both commercial users and families seeking maximum space efficiency.
Citroen-Berlingo.name: Second Generation

Citroen-Berlingo.description: The current Berlingo is built on PSA's EMP2 platform, shared with various Peugeot, Citroën, and Opel/Vauxhall models. Available in M (4.40m) and XL (4.75m) lengths, it features more SUV-inspired styling while maintaining the practical boxy shape. Passenger models, now branded as Berlingo rather than Multispace, offer five or seven-seat configurations with three independent rear seats. Engine options include various efficient petrol and diesel units, plus a fully electric e-Berlingo variant with approximately 280 km (174 miles) of range. The interior offers a modern design with Citroën's Advanced Comfort philosophy, featuring a digital instrument display, 8-inch touchscreen, and numerous clever storage solutions. Available technology includes head-up display, adaptive cruise control, and automatic emergency braking. The third-generation Berlingo elevates the concept beyond its utilitarian roots with improved refinement and technology while maintaining exceptional space efficiency and practicality.
Citroen-Berlingo.name: Third Generation

Citroen-C3.description: The original Citroën C3 was a supermini designed to replace the Saxo in Citroën's lineup. Featuring a distinctive, rounded design with a high roofline that maximized interior space, it offered a refreshing alternative to more conventional competitors. The interior maintained the quirky design approach with a centrally-mounted instrument cluster on some variants and innovative storage solutions. Engine options typically included 1.1L to 1.6L petrol units and 1.4L to 1.6L diesels, paired with manual or automated manual transmissions. A Pluriel convertible variant featured a unique modular roof system that could transform from a hatchback to a full convertible. Production began in April 2002 in Europe and continued through 2010, with Brazilian production extending through 2012. This generation established the C3 as Citroën's core small car offering with a focus on comfort, space efficiency, and distinctive styling.
Citroen-C3.name: First Generation

Citroen-C3.description: The second-generation C3 evolved the formula with slightly more conventional styling while maintaining distinctive Citroën design elements. Revealed in June 2009 at the Frankfurt Motor Show and launched in November 2009, it featured a key innovation with the optional panoramic windscreen that extended into the roof, creating an unusually airy cabin experience (marketed as 'Visiospace'). Built on PSA's PF1 platform, it offered improved refinement and safety features over its predecessor. Engine options expanded to include more efficient units, including new Prince-badged petrol engines and revised diesel options. The interior focused on comfort with improved materials and available features. A facelift launched in March 2013 at the Geneva Motor Show brought updated exterior styling with new chevrons, LED daytime running lights, and revised bumpers. This generation successfully balanced Citroën's traditional focus on comfort with increasingly stringent efficiency and safety requirements.
Citroen-C3.name: Second Generation

Citroen-C3.description: The third-generation C3 featured more distinctive styling inspired by the C4 Cactus, with optional Airbump side panels for protection against minor impacts. Officially revealed on 29 June 2016, the design incorporated SUV-inspired elements with increased ground clearance and protective cladding, reflecting changing market preferences. Built on an updated version of the PF1 platform, it offered efficient PureTech petrol and BlueHDi diesel engines. The interior showcased Citroën's 'Advanced Comfort' approach with supportive seats, simplified controls, and a spacious, airy environment. Technology included a 7-inch touchscreen and connectivity features. This generation successfully positioned the C3 as a characterful alternative in the supermini segment, emphasizing comfort and personalization options.
Citroen-C3.name: Third Generation

Citroen-C3.description: The restyled version of the third-generation C3 was revealed in February 2020, bringing significant visual and technological updates. The main evolutions focused on the front and headlights with new LED designs, updated chevrons and styling cues. New exterior colors were introduced including 'Spring Blue' and 'Rouge Elixir', with two new interior atmospheres called 'Techwood' and 'Emeraude'. The 2020 facelift maintained the same PF1 platform but featured refined engines and improved efficiency. In 2023, a new entry-level 'C3 You' trim was launched as the latest evolution of this generation. This facelift captured the visual and technical refinements that kept the third generation competitive until the introduction of the fourth generation.
Citroen-C3.name: Third Generation (2020 Facelift)

Citroen-C3.description: The fourth-generation C3 represents a complete redesign with two distinct market versions. For India and Latin American markets, it was released on 16 September 2021 and produced since 2022, designed as a modern hatchback with crossover SUV styling. For the European market, the fourth-generation C3 was introduced on 17 October 2023 and entered production in 2024. Both versions are built on the Smart Car Platform (a new, more efficient platform from Stellantis) and feature radically new designs with wider, more modern aesthetics while building on the C3's iconic character. The European version features C-shaped LED headlights, an enclosed grille with Citroën's new logo, and a more refined interior layout. Both versions offer efficient petrol units and mild-hybrid variants, with battery electric variants available (ë-C3). The fourth generation successfully bridges cost-efficiency and modern design, appealing to global markets.
Citroen-C3.name: Fourth Generation

Citroen-C4.description: The original Citroën C4 replaced the Xsara in Citroën's lineup, available as a five-door hatchback and a distinctive three-door coupé with different styling. It featured innovative design elements including a fixed-hub steering wheel (where the center remained stationary while the rim rotated) and dynamic digital displays. Built on PSA's PF2 platform, it offered various petrol and diesel engines ranging from 1.4L to 2.0L, with a performance-oriented VTS model available. Safety was emphasized with a 5-star Euro NCAP rating. The first-generation C4 established the nameplate as Citroën's core C-segment offering with a focus on innovation, distinctive design, and comfort rather than the sporty handling prioritized by some competitors.
Citroen-C4.name: First Generation

Citroen-C4.description: At the 2008 Moscow International Automobile Salon, Citroën presented a facelifted C4 with updated styling. Both hatchback and coupé received cosmetic updates to the front end, which now featured a distinctive 'mouth' and larger trapezoid shape. The grille was redesigned to be slightly curved, with minor updates at the rear. The redesign included a slight lengthening of the car body and introduced the 1.6 Prince engine with variable valve timing and turbocharged direct injection. Ride comfort was improved through suspension refinements, and diesel versions received the Airdream package for reduced emissions and fuel consumption.
Citroen-C4.name: First Generation (2008 Facelift)

Citroen-C4.description: The second-generation C4 made its debut at the 2010 Paris Salon before launching in September 2010. It adopted a more conventional five-door hatchback design, discontinuing the three-door coupé variant (which was effectively replaced by the DS4). Built on an updated PF2 platform, it featured more conservative styling but maintained distinctive Citroën elements. Engine options included PureTech petrol and BlueHDi diesel units, with a focus on reduced emissions and fuel consumption. The interior offered improved quality and technology with modern digital instrumentation combined with analog design elements. This generation balanced Citroën's traditional comfort focus with increased refinement and efficiency.
Citroen-C4.name: Second Generation

Citroen-C4.description: The second-generation C4 received a comprehensive facelift in 2015 with visual and technical updates. The hatchback stayed in production until early 2018. The facelift introduced updated styling cues while maintaining the fundamental platform and overall design direction established in 2010. Engine options remained largely consistent with the pre-facelift model, featuring PureTech petrol and BlueHDi diesel powerplants. The interior received technology updates and refined design elements. Regional variants including the C4L (China), C4 Lounge (South America), and C4 Sedan (Russia) based on the same platform continued production with their own facelift schedules.
Citroen-C4.name: Second Generation (2015 Facelift)

Citroen-C4.description: The third-generation C4 (C41) was revealed on 16 June 2020, representing a significant departure from its predecessors with a coupe SUV styling. Built on PSA's all-new EMP1 platform, it blends hatchback and SUV elements with a coupe-like roofline. The interior features a significant upgrade with more upmarket materials and a larger, wider touchscreen. Powertrain options include 1.2L PureTech turbocharged petrol and 1.5L BlueHDi diesel engines, plus the fully-electric ë-C4 with a 50 kWh battery providing around 350 km (217 miles) of WLTP range. The interior showcases Citroën's 'Advanced Comfort' philosophy with supportive seats, simplified controls, and emphasis on ride quality. A four-door fastback-styling saloon version called the C4 X was unveiled in June 2022. This generation repositions the C4 to bridge multiple segments, reflecting changing consumer preferences.
Citroen-C4.name: Third Generation

Citroen-C4.description: At the 2024 Paris Motor Show, Citroën unveiled the facelifted models of both the C4 and C4 X, inspired by the Oli concept car previewed in 2022. Both models feature a redesigned front fascia with the latest brand logo, while the C4 received a redesigned rear fascia with new LED taillights. Inside, there are new Advanced Comfort seats with thicker foam padding, a new 7-inch digital instrument cluster, and the touchscreen infotainment system features updated software. Other significant changes include new mild hybrid engines and the discontinuation of the manual transmission option. The C4X facelift began assembly in Egypt through the Arab American Vehicles (AAV) plant starting April 2025.
Citroen-C4.name: Third Generation (2025 Facelift)

Citroen-CZero.description: The Citroën C-Zero was a compact all-electric city car that was essentially a rebadged version of the Mitsubishi i-MiEV, produced through a partnership between PSA Peugeot Citroën and Mitsubishi Motors (with the Peugeot iOn being the sister model). The distinctive egg-shaped four-door design prioritized interior space efficiency despite the vehicle's small footprint, measuring just 3.48 meters in length. Powered by a rear-mounted electric motor producing 47 kilowatts (64 HP) and 180 Nm of torque, it drove the rear wheels through a single-speed transmission, offering urban-focused performance with 0-100 km/h acceleration in approximately 15 seconds and a top speed of 130 km/h. The lithium-ion battery was mounted under the floor and provided a real-world range of approximately 130 km on a full charge, with charging possible through standard household outlets (taking about 6 hours) or 400V fast-charging terminals (80% charge in about 30 minutes). The interior was basic but functional, offering seating for four adults and standard features including power steering, ESP, six airbags, power windows, air conditioning, and telematics. Production began in late 2010 and ended in 2020 as the Citroën Ami replaced it. Assembly was performed in Japan (Kurashiki, Okayama, 2010-2012) and Spain (Vigo, Galicia, 2012-2020).
Citroen-CZero.name: First Generation

Citroen-E-C4.description: The Citroën ë-C4 is the all-electric variant of the third-generation C4, sharing its crossover-inspired design that blends hatchback, SUV, and coupe elements. Unveiled on 16 June 2020, it is built on Stellantis' PSA EMP1 dedicated electric platform. The pre-facelift version features a distinctive exterior with a sloping roofline, split-level lighting, and protective body cladding. Power comes from a front-mounted electric motor producing 100 kW (136 HP) and 260 Nm of torque, enabling 0-100 km/h acceleration in approximately 9.7 seconds and a top speed of 150 km/h. The 50 kWh lithium-ion battery is mounted under the floor and provides a WLTP range of approximately 350 km (217 miles). Charging capabilities include support for up to 100 kW DC fast charging. The interior showcases Citroën's 'Advanced Comfort' philosophy with particularly supportive seats, a 10-inch touchscreen infotainment system, digital instrument display, and a unique retractable head-up display. Suspension features Progressive Hydraulic Cushions for exceptional ride quality. The ë-C4 offers three driving modes (Eco, Normal, and Sport) and adjustable regenerative braking levels. As one of the first electric vehicles based on the EMP1 platform, the ë-C4 represents Citroën's initial step in its electrification strategy, offering zero-emission mobility in a distinctive package that bridges multiple vehicle segments.
Citroen-E-C4.name: First Generation

Citroen-E-C4.description: The 2025 facelift of the Citroën ë-C4, unveiled at the 2024 Paris Motor Show, introduces significant visual and technical updates. The exterior features a redesigned front fascia with the latest Citroën brand logo and new LED taillights. The interior has been substantially refreshed with new Advanced Comfort seats featuring thicker foam padding, a new 7-inch digital instrument cluster, and updated touchscreen infotainment software. The ë-C4 continues to be powered by the 100 kW electric motor on the PSA EMP1 platform, now with enhanced battery options up to 54 kWh, extending the WLTP range to 415 km. The manual transmission option has been discontinued. All other core features remain consistent with the pre-facelift generation, maintaining Citroën's commitment to comfort and zero-emission mobility.
Citroen-E-C4.name: First Generation (2025 Facelift)

Citroen-eC4-X.description: The Citroën ë-C4 X is an electric fastback sedan variant of the ë-C4, featuring a distinctive body style that blends elements of a traditional sedan with SUV-inspired ground clearance and a coupe-like sloping roofline. Built on Stellantis' e-CMP platform, it's longer than the standard ë-C4 by approximately 240mm, primarily benefiting the rear overhang and creating a 510-liter trunk (versus 380 liters in the standard model). The powertrain is identical to the ë-C4, consisting of a front-mounted electric motor producing 136 HP (100 kW) and 260 Nm of torque, paired with a 50 kWh lithium-ion battery. This setup provides a WLTP range of up to 360 km (224 miles), slightly improved over the standard ë-C4 due to better aerodynamics. Charging capabilities include support for up to 100 kW DC fast charging, allowing a 0-80% charge in about 30 minutes. The interior is largely shared with the ë-C4, featuring Citroën's 'Advanced Comfort' seats, a 10-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and comprehensive driver assistance technologies. The suspension utilizes Progressive Hydraulic Cushions for exceptional ride comfort, a key brand differentiator. The ë-C4 X was developed primarily for markets where sedans remain popular, particularly Southern Europe, the Middle East, and Africa, offering a distinctive alternative that combines the practicality of a sedan trunk with crossover styling elements and zero-emission electric propulsion. Unlike the standard C4, which offers both combustion and electric powertrains in most European markets, the C4 X is available exclusively as an electric vehicle in many Western European countries, reflecting the accelerating transition to electrification.
Citroen-eC4-X.name: First Generation

Cupra-Born.description: The Cupra Born is the first all-electric vehicle from SEAT's performance-oriented Cupra sub-brand. Built on Volkswagen Group's MEB platform shared with the VW ID.3, it features distinctive, aggressive styling that sets it apart from its Volkswagen cousin. The exterior showcases Cupra's design language with sharp lines, copper accents, and sportier details including a more pronounced front splitter and diffuser. The official premiere took place in May 2021, with production starting in September 2021. At launch there were two powertrains: a base 110 kW rear motor and a more powerful 150 kW / 204 hp model with 310 Nm torque, the latter enabling 0-100 km/h acceleration in 6.6 seconds. Battery options included 45 kWh, 55 kWh, and 77 kWh configurations with ranges from 340 to 540 kilometers on the WLTP cycle. Charging on a fast charger to 80% takes 35-60 minutes depending on battery size. The interior features a 12-inch infotainment touchscreen, sports seats with integrated headrests, a head-up display, and adaptive cruise control with Travel Assist system for semi-autonomous driving. Dynamic Chassis Control Sport suspension and traffic sign recognition are standard. The Born represents Cupra's vision for performance-oriented electric mobility, offering a more emotionally engaging alternative to mainstream EVs.
Cupra-Born.name: First Generation

Cupra-Born.description: In 2024, the Cupra Born received a significant facelift. The more powerful VZ variant was introduced with a 240 kW / 326 hp motor and 545 Nm torque, achieving 0-100 km/h in 5.6 seconds. New powertrain options include the 59 kWh Born with E-Boost Pack and the 77 kWh with E-Boost Pack, replacing earlier configurations. The Born 45 was cancelled. The 77 kWh and 77 kWh E-Boost Pack variants continue with 170 kW output. Charging was upgraded with the E-Boost Pack versions supporting higher power DC charging up to 165-175 kW. The facelift brought visual and technical refreshes that maintain the Cupra design language while improving performance and efficiency. The Born continues as Cupra's flagship electric hatchback, manufactured in Zwickau, Germany on the MEB platform.
Cupra-Born.name: First Generation (2024 Facelift)

Cupra-Formentor.description: The Cupra Formentor is the first standalone model developed specifically for SEAT's performance-oriented Cupra sub-brand rather than being derived from an existing SEAT model. Built on Volkswagen Group's MQB Evo platform, it features a distinctive coupe-SUV design with sharp, aggressive styling that emphasizes sportiness over traditional SUV utility. The exterior showcases Cupra's design language with angular lines, a sloping roofline, full-width rear light bar, and signature copper accents. Powertrain options are extensive, ranging from a 150 HP 1.5L TSI to a range-topping 2.5L five-cylinder turbo producing 390 HP in the VZ5 limited edition model. The lineup also includes 2.0L TSI variants with outputs from 190 HP to 310 HP and plug-in hybrid (eHybrid) versions combining a 1.4L TSI engine with an electric motor for a combined output of up to 245 HP and approximately 50 km (31 miles) of electric-only range. Most powerful variants feature 4Drive all-wheel drive, while entry models are front-wheel drive. The interior offers a driver-focused cockpit with a 12-inch infotainment touchscreen, digital instrument cluster, and sports seats with copper stitching. The driving experience emphasizes handling and performance, with features including Dynamic Chassis Control adaptive suspension on higher-end models. The Formentor represents Cupra's positioning as a more emotionally engaging, performance-focused alternative to mainstream brands, blending crossover practicality with sports car influence in both design and driving dynamics.
Cupra-Formentor.name: First Generation

Cupra-Formentor.description: The 2024 facelift of the Cupra Formentor was officially revealed in April 2024, introducing significant styling and technology updates while maintaining the same MQB Evo platform. The exterior received a complete redesign with a new LED headlight signature featuring three triangular elements, restyled front fascia, and redesigned rear fascia with new full-width LED taillights using triangular elements. Additional exterior updates include an illuminated Cupra logo, updated bumper design, and new alloy wheel designs. Inside, the facelift features a larger 12.9-inch touchscreen infotainment system with updated software, replacing the previous 12-inch display. Climate and audio controls were redesigned with illuminated slider controls positioned below the touchscreen. The Formentor also received a new premium sound system by Sennheiser, replacing the previous Beats Electronics system. All mechanical powertrains from the original generation remain available, with the same range of options from the 150 HP 1.5L TSI entry model to the 390 HP 2.5L five-cylinder turbo VZ5 variant and the 245 HP 1.4L TSI plug-in hybrid option.
Cupra-Formentor.name: First Generation (2024 Facelift)

Cupra-Leon.description: The Cupra Leon (Mk4, model codes KL1/KL8) represents the first generation of the Leon under SEAT's performance-oriented Cupra marque, which became a standalone brand in 2018. Built on Volkswagen Group's MQB Evo platform (also used by the Audi A3 Mk4, Volkswagen Golf Mk8, and Skoda Octavia Mk4), it features aggressive styling with distinctive Cupra design elements including copper-accented badging, darkened trim, and sportier bumpers and side skirts. Production began in January 2020. Available in five-door hatchback and estate (ST) form, it offers multiple powertrain options. The petrol lineup includes 2.0L TSI engines with 242 bhp and 296 bhp outputs (with the range-topping 306 bhp Cupra ST 4Drive estate-only version available with four-wheel-drive). A plug-in hybrid variant (eHybrid) combines a 1.4L TSI engine with an electric motor for a combined 242 bhp output and approximately 32 miles (51 km) of electric-only range. The Cupra Leon features a sportier suspension setup, sitting 25mm lower at the front and 20mm lower at the rear compared to the standard SEAT Leon. Interior highlights include sports seats with copper stitching, digital cockpit, 10-inch infotainment touchscreen, and ambient lighting. The Cupra Leon 300TSI variant launched in early 2021 with the same turbocharged 2.0-litre engine producing 296 bhp and 400 Nm of torque, enabling 0-62 mph in 5.7 seconds.
Cupra-Leon.name: First Generation (2020-2023)

Cupra-Leon.description: A mid-cycle facelift for the Cupra Leon was released in 2024, adopting the new Tavascan design language with updated exterior styling while maintaining the same MQB Evo platform and core powertrain lineup. The facelift brings visual updates to the front and rear design elements while preserving the performance characteristics and interior features of the pre-facelift model.
Cupra-Leon.name: First Generation (2024 Facelift)

Cupra-Leon-Sportstourer.description: The Cupra Leon Sportstourer is the estate/wagon variant of the Cupra Leon, representing the first generation of this body style under SEAT's performance-oriented Cupra sub-brand. Launched in January 2020, it is built on Volkswagen Group's MQB Evo platform (model codes KL1/KL8), which it shares with the Volkswagen Golf Mk8, Audi A3 Mk4, and Škoda Octavia Mk4. The estate variant combines the aggressive styling of the Cupra Leon hatchback with the added practicality of an estate body. Distinctive design elements include copper accents, dark trim pieces, quad exhaust outlets, and sportier bumpers and side skirts. The Sportstourer offers 617 liters of boot space (30 liters more than the previous generation), significantly more than the hatchback's 380 liters, making it practical for enthusiasts who need extra cargo capacity. Powertrain options include a 2.0L TSI petrol engine with 242 HP or 296 HP outputs, with the most powerful variant (306 HP ST 4Drive) featuring 4-wheel drive. A plug-in hybrid variant (eHybrid) combines a 1.4L TSI engine with an electric motor for a combined output of 242 HP and approximately 60 km (37 miles) of electric-only range. The interior features sports seats with copper stitching, a digital cockpit, 10-inch infotainment touchscreen, and ambient lighting. Performance enhancements include sports suspension, progressive steering, and larger brakes with Brembo calipers. The Cupra Leon Sportstourer offers a compelling combination of performance, distinctive styling, and practical utility, positioned as a more exclusive alternative to mainstream performance estates.
Cupra-Leon-Sportstourer.name: First Generation (2020-2023)

Cupra-Leon-Sportstourer.description: The Cupra Leon Sportstourer received a facelift in 2024 that adopts the new Tavascan design language. This update represents a visual and technical refresh of the same underlying MQB Evo platform while maintaining the estate body style and performance focus. The facelift introduces updated exterior styling including revised front and rear bumpers, new headlight and taillight designs reflecting Cupra's updated design direction. Performance and powertrain options remain similar to the pre-facelift model, with 2.0L TSI petrol engines available in 242 HP and 296 HP outputs, with the range-topping ST 4Drive producing 306 HP. The plug-in hybrid eHybrid option continues with 242 HP combined output. The refresh maintains the practical 617-liter boot space and reinforces Cupra's positioning as a standalone performance brand offering emotionally engaging vehicles that blend driving dynamics with everyday usability.
Cupra-Leon-Sportstourer.name: First Generation (2024 Facelift)

DS-7.description: The DS 7 (initially launched as DS 7 Crossback) is the first dedicated mid-size SUV from DS Automobiles, Citroën's luxury sub-brand that became a standalone marque in 2014. Built on PSA Group's (now Stellantis) EMP2 platform shared with various Peugeot and Citroën models, it features distinctive styling with an elaborate front end incorporating jewel-like LED headlights and a prominent grille with diamond pattern motif. The exterior design emphasizes French luxury with chrome accents, sculpted body panels, and intricate light signatures including rear lights with laser-etched scale patterns. Initially offered with a range of petrol and diesel engines, the lineup expanded to include plug-in hybrid variants badged E-TENSE, offering up to 300 HP and approximately 60 km (37 miles) of electric-only range in later models. The interior showcases DS's approach to luxury with unique design elements including a dashboard-mounted BRM timepiece that rotates into view on startup, watch strap-inspired leather upholstery, and pearl stitching. Technology features include DS Connected Pilot semi-autonomous driving capabilities, DS Night Vision, and an active scan suspension system that uses a camera to detect road imperfections.
DS-7.name: First Generation

DS-7.description: A significant facelift in 2022 introduced a more streamlined front end design, updated lighting, and enhanced technology including a new 12-inch infotainment screen and updated driver assistance systems. The model was renamed from DS 7 Crossback to DS 7 globally starting in 2023. The facelift brought a more refined approach to the vehicle's visual identity while maintaining the EMP2 platform foundation. Enhanced powertrain options included updated hybrid variants with increased power output up to 360 HP for the E-Tense 4x4 version. The DS 7 represents the brand's interpretation of French luxury applied to the popular mid-size SUV segment, offering a distinctive alternative to established German and British premium brands.
DS-7.name: First Generation (2022 Facelift)

Dacia-Duster.description: The original Dacia Duster was a game-changer in the budget SUV segment, offering robust design and genuine off-road capability at an exceptionally competitive price point. Built on the Renault-Nissan B0 platform shared with various Renault and Nissan models, it was available in both front-wheel and four-wheel drive configurations. Engine options included various petrol and diesel units, typically ranging from 1.2L to 2.0L, with modest power outputs prioritizing reliability and efficiency over performance. The interior was basic and utilitarian, focusing on durability rather than luxury, with simple controls and hard-wearing materials. Despite its budget positioning, the Duster offered genuine off-road credibility with good ground clearance, short overhangs, and a capable 4WD system. This first generation established the Duster as a phenomenally successful model for Dacia, appealing to pragmatic buyers seeking SUV practicality without premium pricing.
Dacia-Duster.name: First Generation (HS)

Dacia-Duster.description: In September 2013, the facelifted Dacia Duster was presented at the Frankfurt Motor Show, introducing significant styling updates. The exterior received important changes in the front with a new chromed grille and redesigned headlights, restyled roof bars, and new 16-inch wheels with modest modifications in the rear. The interior was renewed with design and features similar to those introduced on the new models in the Dacia line-up. A new TCe 125 1.2-litre direct-injection turbo engine was introduced as a more efficient powertrain option. In 2016, the Duster received a new steering wheel and a Blackshadow trim variant. The facelift maintained the successful off-road capabilities and value proposition of the original, continuing to appeal to budget-conscious buyers seeking genuine SUV practicality.
Dacia-Duster.name: First Generation (HS) 2013 Facelift

Dacia-Duster.description: The second-generation Duster was announced between 14 and 24 September 2017 during the Frankfurt Motor Show, with production models reaching the Romanian market in November 2017. Built on an updated version of the B0 platform (B0+), it featured completely new bodywork with more modern styling but preserved the recognizable Duster silhouette and proportions. Nearly every body panel was new, though dimensions remained nearly identical. Engine options evolved to include more efficient units including a 1.0L I3 turbo petrol, 1.2L and 1.3L TCe petrol, and 1.5L dCi diesel engines. The interior saw significant improvements in design, quality, and technology, including electric power steering, a four-camera MultiView system, blind-spot warning, automatic climate control, and keyless entry. Safety features were enhanced with multiple airbags and electronic stability control. Four-wheel drive variants maintained impressive off-road capability with hill descent control and hill-start assist. This generation successfully modernized the Duster while maintaining its value proposition.
Dacia-Duster.name: Second Generation (HM)

Dacia-Duster.description: The restyled version of the Duster was presented on June 22, 2021, and went on sale in September 2021. The facelifted version featured a new light signature both front and rear, similar to the third-generation Sandero, with an updated Y-shaped LED daytime running light pattern. The grille pattern was slightly simplified and a sliding central armrest was added inside. The number of engines available was reduced, with two petrol engines of 130 and 150 hp, a petrol/LPG version of 100 hp, and a 115 hp diesel engine available in all-wheel drive. The most powerful engine became available as standard with the 6-speed automatic transmission (EDC6). In June 2022, as part of a brand-wide refresh, the Duster received an update featuring the brand's new logo, a redesigned grille, updated steering wheel, and refreshed badges. This final iteration of the second generation maintained the successful formula while incorporating the latest Dacia brand identity.
Dacia-Duster.name: Second Generation (HM) 2021 Facelift

Dacia-Duster.description: The latest Duster represents the most significant redesign since the model's introduction, adopting Dacia's new design language with a more robust and contemporary appearance. The third generation was unveiled on 29 November 2023 in Portugal and began production in December 2023. Built on the Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi Alliance's CMF-B platform (shared with the Sandero, Logan, and Jogger), it features improved proportions with a more muscular stance and boxy exterior design with new Y-shaped light signature. The powertrain lineup embraces electrification with mild-hybrid technology standard on most engines, plus new full-hybrid options combining 1.6L or 1.8L petrol engines with electric motors for significantly improved efficiency. Bi-fuel petrol/LPG options remain available (ECO-G), maintaining Dacia's focus on affordable motoring. Diesel engines (1.5L dCi) continue in limited markets only. Four-wheel drive continues to be offered with multiple terrain modes (Auto, Snow, Mud/Sand, Off-Road, Eco) and hill descent control. The interior features a completely redesigned dashboard with a 10.1-inch touchscreen (largest yet) and a 7-inch digital instrument cluster with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto wireless connectivity. The trunk volume increased to 472 litres. Despite these advancements, the third-generation Duster remains true to Dacia's value-oriented philosophy, offering modern features and improved refinement while maintaining competitive pricing.
Dacia-Duster.name: Third Generation (P1310)

Dacia-Lodgy.description: The Dacia Lodgy is a compact multi-purpose vehicle (MPV) produced by the French manufacturer Renault and its Romanian subsidiary Dacia since 2012. Built on the Nissan B platform (Dacia M0 platform), it featured a boxy, utilitarian design that prioritized interior space and functionality. Available in five or seven-seat configurations, the early generation offered a choice of four-cylinder engines: 1.2L turbocharged petrol Energy TCe 115, 1.6L naturally aspirated petrol, and a 1.5L turbocharged diesel dCi. The interior was basic but functional, with features including speed limiters, navigation systems with seven-inch touchscreen displays, Bluetooth and USB connectivity. A Stepway variant added SUV-inspired styling elements including increased ride height, roof rails, and plastic body cladding. The vehicle successfully filled a market gap for affordable family transportation.
Dacia-Lodgy.name: First Generation

Dacia-Lodgy.description: The Dacia Lodgy received a facelift in 2017, which included subtle updates to the exterior and interior. The facelifted model introduced additional engine options including a 1.3L turbocharged petrol H5Ht engine alongside the existing powerplants. The facelift period saw continued evolution of technology features and design refinement while maintaining the same M0 platform. Production continued until 2022, when the model was succeeded by the Dacia Jogger, which combines MPV practicality with crossover styling elements. The Lodgy was also sold in India (2015-2020) as the Renault Lodgy under Renault branding in CIS countries, Ukraine, and India.
Dacia-Lodgy.name: First Generation (2017 Facelift)

Dacia-Sandero.description: The original Dacia Sandero was a budget-friendly supermini built on the Renault-Nissan B0 platform shared with the first-generation Dacia Logan. Featuring simple, functional styling and a basic hatchback layout, it prioritized affordability and practicality over design flair. Engine options typically included 1.2L to 1.6L petrol units and a 1.5L dCi diesel, all focused on reliability and economy rather than performance. The interior was spartan but durable, with minimal technology features and simple, hard-wearing materials. Despite its no-frills approach, the Sandero offered good interior space for its class and reasonable build quality for its price point. Revealed at the 2007 Frankfurt Motor Show and debuting in Brazil in December 2007, it was formally launched in Europe at the 2008 Geneva Motor Show. This generation established the Sandero as Dacia's entry-level hatchback, appealing to value-conscious buyers across Europe and developing markets.
Dacia-Sandero.name: First Generation

Dacia-Sandero.description: A facelifted version of the first-generation Sandero was launched in May 2011 in Brazil, and subsequently arrived in Colombia at the beginning of 2012. The facelift introduced a new front and rear design along with a revised interior. This revised version continued on the same B0 platform but brought visual and interior updates that refreshed the model's appearance while maintaining the value-oriented philosophy.
Dacia-Sandero.name: First Generation (2011 Facelift)

Dacia-Sandero.description: The second-generation Sandero was revealed at the 2012 Paris Motor Show in September 2012 and built on the updated Dacia M0 platform. It maintained the value-oriented approach but with improved design, quality, and features. Engine options evolved to include more efficient units, including a 0.9L TCe turbocharged three-cylinder. The interior saw significant improvements in design and material quality, with higher trims offering features previously unavailable including a touchscreen infotainment system. The Stepway variant, with its increased ride height, roof rails, and plastic body cladding, gained significant popularity, accounting for a large proportion of sales in many markets. This generation significantly increased the Sandero's appeal beyond purely budget-conscious buyers, becoming Europe's best-selling retail car model by the end of its production run.
Dacia-Sandero.name: Second Generation

Dacia-Sandero.description: A revised Dacia Sandero was released in November 2016 at the 2016 Paris Motor Show. On the outside, the facelifted version featured LED daytime running lights and restyled taillights. Dacia also updated its engine range with a 1.0-litre, three-cylinder petrol engine that replaced the older 1.2-litre unit in entry-level trims. This facelift maintained the same platform and overall design philosophy while introducing modernized styling and powertrain improvements.
Dacia-Sandero.name: Second Generation (2016 Facelift)

Dacia-Sandero.description: Another facelift was announced in July 2019 for model year 2020, exclusive to the Renault-badged variant produced in Brazil. This upgrade brought a slightly revised front end and a significantly redesigned rear end, with rear tail lights extending to the tailgate.
